prosapodosis: <entryFree id="n39002" type="main" key="pro^sa^po^do^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏsăpŏdŏsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n39002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a figure of speech</hi>, defined by Mart. Cap. § 533 Kopp (al. proapodosis, q. v.).</sense></entryFree>
prosarius: <entryFree id="n39003" type="main" key="pro_sa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. prosa</etym>, <sense id="n39003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to prose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosaic</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquendi genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prosator: <entryFree id="n39004" type="main" key="pro_sa^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsător</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pro-sero</etym>, <sense id="n39004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancestor</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 1, 90.</sense></entryFree>
prosatrix: <entryFree id="n39005" type="main" key="pro_satrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsatrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancestress</hi>, Isid. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
prosatus: <entryFree id="n39006" type="main" key="pro_sa^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsătus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. prosero.</entryFree>
proscaenium: <entryFree id="n39007" type="greek" key="proscaeni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proscaenĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">proscēn-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>,= <foreign lang="greek">proskh/nion</foreign>. <sense id="n39007.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The place before the scene where the actors appeared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the proscenium;</hi> also, in gen., <hi rend="ital">the stage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:prol. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. prol. 10</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteres ineunt proscaenia ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatrum et proscaenium ad Apollinis locavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscaenii contabulatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 4, p. 359, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n39007.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a theatre</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 403</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proscholus: <entryFree id="n39008" type="greek" key="proscho^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proschŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/sxolos</foreign>, <sense id="n39008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an under-teacher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under-master</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tam pauper, ut proscholus esset grammatici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. Apostol. Serm. 178" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. Apostol. Serm. 178</bibl></cit>, n. 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 22</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
proscindo: <entryFree id="n39009" type="main" key="pro_scindo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-scindo</orth>, <itype>scĭdi, scissum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n39009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tear open in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">split</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut in pieces</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n39009.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39009.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro proscindere quercum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 434</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 300, 18</bibl></cit> and 20: <cit><quote lang="la">spumanti Rhodanus proscindens gurgite campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:449" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnere pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:439" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 439</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgure terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:3:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39009.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in agriculture, of the first ploughing, <hi rend="ital">to break up</hi> the land: rursum terram cum primum arant, proscindere appellant; cum iterum, offringere dicunt, quod primā aratione glebae grandes solent excitari. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:29:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 29, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:27:2" default="NO">1, 27, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram transversis adversisque sulcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: priusquam ares, proscindito, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 176</bibl>: bubulcum autem per proscissum ingredi <cb n="PROS" /> oportet, <hi rend="ital">the trench</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furrow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:4" default="NO">3, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:32" default="NO">11, 2, 32</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in gen., for arare, <hi rend="ital">to plough</hi>: rorulentas terras, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 395, 22</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 496 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">validis terram proscinde juvencis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram pressis aratris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro campum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39009.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cut through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cleave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furrow</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): rostro ventosum aequor. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">remo stagna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:603" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 603</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39009.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cut up</hi> with words, <hi rend="ital">to censure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satirize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equestrem ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem foedissimo convicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carminibus proscissus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 6, 7, § 48</bibl></cit>: aliquem famoso carmine, Suet. Vit. Luc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:5:2" default="NO">8, 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proscissio: <entryFree id="n39010" type="main" key="pro_scissi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōscissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>proscindo, I. B.</etym>. In agriculture, <sense id="n39010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first ploughing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a breaking up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:13:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:8" default="NO">6, 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proscissus: <entryFree id="n39011" type="main" key="pro_scissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōscissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from proscindo.</entryFree>
proscribo: <entryFree id="n39012" type="main" key="pro_scri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-scrībo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n39012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to write before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to write over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to inscribe.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39012.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vultus voluntariā poenarum lege proscripti,</quote> <trans><tr>written over</tr>, <tr>inscribed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39012.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39012.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To publish</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">by writing</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut quo die esse oporteret idus Januarias, eo die Calendas Martias proscriberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (legem) non is promulgavit, quo nomine proscriptam videtis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 69</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">177: non proscriptā neque edictā die,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 54, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versiculos per vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39012.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum Calendis velle se frequentem adesse, etiam Formiis proscribi jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscribit se auctionem esse facturum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 4, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39012.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To offer in writing</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">for sale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lease</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">hire</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">as to be sold by auction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to post up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advertise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscribere palam sic accipimus, claris litteris, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:3:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Racilius tabulam proscripsit, se familiam Catonianam venditurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Claudius proscripsit insulam, vendidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 16, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39012.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To publish</hi> a person <hi rend="ital">as having forfeited his property</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to punish with confiscation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to confiscate</hi> one's property (cf. publico): <cit><quote lang="la">quaero enim, quid sit aliud proscribere. Velitis, jubeatis, ut M. Tullius in civitate ne sit, bonaque ejus ut mea sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:17:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 17, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeium,</quote> <trans><tr>to confiscate the estates gained by him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:36:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 36, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinos,</quote> <trans><tr>to confiscate the lands of one's neighbors</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 18, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39012.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To proscribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outlaw</hi> one, by hanging up a tablet with his name and sentence of outlawry, confiscation of goods, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">posteaquam victoria constituta est, cum proscriberentur homines, qui adversarii fuisse putabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriā Sullae parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modus proscribendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>P. a.</pos>, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōscriptus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <hi rend="ital">an outlaw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one proscribed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra legem Corneliam, quae proscriptum juvari vetat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:47:section=123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 47, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscriptorum liberos honores petere puduit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 30, 31, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proscriptorum numero esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona proscriptorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 31</bibl></cit> Dietsch.— </sense><sense id="n39012.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus pudoris dignitas in concione proscripta sit,</quote> <trans><tr>has been brought into ill repute</tr>, <tr>rendered suspected</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 106</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proscriptio: <entryFree id="n39013" type="main" key="pro_scripti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōscriptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>proscribo</etym> (class.). <sense id="n39013.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A written public notice</hi> of sale. <hi rend="ital">an advertisement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscriptio bonorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 18, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam ad diem proscriptiones venditionesque fiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:44:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 44, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praediorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 30, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39013.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Proscription</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outlawry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confiscation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscriptionis miserrimum nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:17:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 17, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de capite civis et de bonis proscriptionem ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:30:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 30, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscriptione pecunias ex aerario accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proscriptor: <entryFree id="n39014" type="main" key="pro_scriptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-scriptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who proscribes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">oullaws; adj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proscriptive</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">proscriptor animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 56</bibl></cit>; cf. proscripturio.</sense></entryFree>
proscriptura: <entryFree id="n39015" type="gloss" key="pro_scriptu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōscriptūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">proscription</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outlawry</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proscripturio: <entryFree id="n39016" type="main" key="pro_scriptu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōscriptŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n39016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. desider. n</hi> [id], <hi rend="ital">to desire</hi> or <hi rend="ital">long to proscribe</hi>, (a word formed <pb n="1475" /> <cb n="PROS" /> sarcastically by Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">ita sullaturit animus ejus et proscripturit diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 6</bibl></cit> (cited <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 32</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
proscriptus: <entryFree id="n39017" type="main" key="pro_scriptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōscriptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from proscribo.</entryFree>
proseco: <entryFree id="n39018" type="main" key="pro_se^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-sĕco</orth>, <itype>cŭi, ctum</itype> (old <sense id="n39018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> parag. prosecarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 1, 8</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to cut off from before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut away</hi> or <hi rend="ital">off.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39018.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">prosectis naso prius ac mox auribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 128, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39018.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39018.3" n="A" level="2"> In agriculture, <hi rend="ital">to cut up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break up</hi> with the plough (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39018.4" n="B" level="2"> In relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi> the parts to be sacrificed: <cit><quote lang="la">vetui exta prosecarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi exta prosecta erunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiae exta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exta prosecuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prosecta pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:439" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 439</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39018.5" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to sacrifice</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Aesculapio gallinaceum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 46</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-sectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is cut off for sacrifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the entrails</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=110" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 110</bibl> Müll.; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:163" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:641" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 641</bibl>; Licin. Macer. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 220, 20</bibl>.—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsecta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 220, 22</bibl> dub. (al. prosicies).</sense></entryFree>
prosecro: <entryFree id="n39019" type="main" key="pro_se^cro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-sĕcro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>sacro</etym>, <sense id="n39019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sacrifice</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">daemonibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aesculapio gallum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 20, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epit. 23, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">37, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prosecta: <entryFree id="n39020" type="main" key="pro_secta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsecta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. proseco <sense id="n39020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
prosectio: <entryFree id="n39021" type="main" key="pro_secti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>proseco</etym>, <sense id="n39021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amputation</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ferri prosectio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Gub. D. 6, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prosector: <entryFree id="n39022" type="main" key="pro_sector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who cuts in pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cutter up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an anatomist</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prosectum: <entryFree id="n39023" type="main" key="pro_sectum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. proseco <sense id="n39023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
prosectus: <entryFree id="n39024" type="main" key="pro_sectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from proseco.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39025" type="main" key="pro_sectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>proseco</etym>, <sense id="n39025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slashing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stroke</hi> (Appul.): <cit><quote lang="la">prosectu gladiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 214, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium,</quote> <trans><tr>a bite</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>, p. 203, 20.</sense></entryFree>
prosecutio: <entryFree id="n39026" type="main" key="pro_se^cu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsĕcūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prosequor</etym>. <sense id="n39026.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a following</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accompanying on the way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attendance</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">necessitas prosecutionis, Cod. Th. 8, 5, 47: prosecutio opportuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 7:59" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 7, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39026.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39026.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A following with words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an honorable notice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mention</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā prosecutione simplicitatem ejus edisseram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Exc. Frat. Sat. 1, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39026.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A continuation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Fid. 2, 13, 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prosecutor: <entryFree id="n39027" type="main" key="pro_se^cu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsĕcūtor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prōsĕquūtor</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accompanier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">companion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an attendant</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:3:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 3, 7</bibl>; Cod. Th. 8, 5, 47; 10, 72, 1; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 6, 12 et saep.: caterva prosecutorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prosecutoria: <entryFree id="n39028" type="main" key="pro_se^cu_to_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsĕcūtōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. epistula) [prosecutor], <sense id="n39028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a letter relating to taking something in charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a letter of authorization</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 72, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prosecutus: <entryFree id="n39029" type="main" key="pro_se^cu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsĕcūtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prōsĕquūtus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from prosequor.</entryFree>
proseda: <entryFree id="n39030" type="main" key="pro_se^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-sĕda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sedeo</etym> (she who sits in public), <sense id="n39030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a common prostitute</hi> (perh. only Plaut.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 53</bibl>; cf.: prosedas meretrices Plautus appellat, quod ante stabula sedeant. Eaedem et prostibulae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=226" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 226</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
prosedamum: <entryFree id="n39031" type="foreign" key="proseda^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prosedămum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sarmatian</etym>, = pigritia equorum in coitu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 63, § 98</bibl>.</entryFree>
proselenus: <entryFree id="n39032" type="main" key="Pro^se^le_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏsĕlēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*prose/lhnos</foreign>, <sense id="n39032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">older than the moon</hi>, a name by which the Arcadians called themselves, Cic. Fragm. Or. pro Fund. 3 B. and K. (<bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 2, 342</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
proselytus: <entryFree id="n39033" type="greek" key="pro^se_ly^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏsēlytus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">prosh/lutos</foreign>, <sense id="n39033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">come from abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strange</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">numeravit Salomon omnes viros proselytos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n39033.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏsēlytus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n39033.2" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sojourner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stranger</hi> in the land: <cit><quote lang="la">proselyti et advenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tob. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 14, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39033.3" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">one that has come over from heathenism to the Jewish religion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a proselyte</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 64</bibl>, n. 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:23:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 23, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 465</bibl>, n. 101.—</sense><sense id="n39033.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏsēlyta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female proselyte</hi>, <hi rend="ital">converted woman</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 25, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proseminator: <entryFree id="n39034" type="main" key="pro_se_mi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-sēmĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>prosemino</etym>, <sense id="n39034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sower;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">a disseminator</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 13</bibl>. <cb n="PROS" /></sense></entryFree>
prosemino: <entryFree id="n39035" type="main" key="pro_se_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-sēmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n39035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scatter about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sow</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n39035.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: ostreas, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 216, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam ex draconis alicujus dentibus proseminati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 10, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39035.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to disseminate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propagate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proseminatae sunt familiae, i. e. ortae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:16:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 16, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 1, 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prosentio: <entryFree id="n39036" type="hapax" key="pro_senti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-sentĭo</orth>, <itype>sensi, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n39036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to perceive beforehand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prosequium: <entryFree id="n39037" type="gloss" key="pro_se^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsĕquĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>prosequor</etym>, <sense id="n39037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">attendance</hi>: prosequium a prosequendo, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=226" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 226</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
prosequor: <entryFree id="n39038" type="main" key="pro_se^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-sĕquor</orth>, <itype>cūtus</itype> (quūtus), 3, <sense id="n39038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi> (in a friendly or hostile manner), <hi rend="ital">to accompany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend; to follow after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pursue</hi> (class.; cf.: comitor, stipo). </sense><sense id="n39038.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum maritum volo rus prosequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum milites electi circiter CXX. sunt prosecuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dianam ture odoribusque incensis prosecutae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:35:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 35, § 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum omnes illum prosequebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:1:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsequias,</quote> <trans><tr>to attend a funeral</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:8:14" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 8, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">defunctum in conditorium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 111</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Bassus noster videtur mihi prosequi se,</quote> <trans><tr>to attend his own funeral</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 30:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 30, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis ad saevas prosequor usque fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 4, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 10, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeneas Prosequitur lacrimans longe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 476</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 72</bibl>.—In a hostile sense, <hi rend="ital">to follow after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pursue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugientes prosequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novissimos multa millia passuum prosecuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste iratus hominem verbis vehementioribus prosequitur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>assailed</tr>, <tr>attacked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:29:section=73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 29, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem contumeliosis vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculatores, qui prosequerentur agmen, missi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:29" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armati qui eos prosequebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:13:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem lapidibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 90</bibl></cit>.—Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">eādem cane anxie prosequente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:615" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 615</bibl>.—With <case>abl.</case>, of following with the eyes: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis abeuntem prosequor udis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos visu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:483" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 483</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39038.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. and abstr. subjects, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pursue; to accompany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prosequitur surgens a puppi ventus euntes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves mitterent quae se prosequerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">datae duae triremes ad prosequendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cattos suos saltus Hercynius prosequitur simul atque deponit,</quote> <trans><tr>goes as far as their territory extends</tr>, <tr>and then ceases</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem (existimatio Quintum) usque ad rogum prosequatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 31, 99</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(amici) mortui vivunt: tantus eos honos prosequitur amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39038.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39038.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">present</hi> one <hi rend="ital">with</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to bestow</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> one; constr. with <case>abl.</case>, rarely with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentiā, aut misericordiā prosequi aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem honorificis verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:25:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 25, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem alicujus gratā memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen alicujus grato animo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam cujuspiam clamore et plausu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem laudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem beneficiis ac liberalitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:41:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 41, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum me in illo tristi et acerbo luctu atque discessu non lacrimis solum tuis, sed animo, corpore, copiis prosecutus esses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:30:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 30, 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum est ut tuam profectionem amore prosequar, reditum spe exspectem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delictum veniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maximum libenter apud te testimonio prosequar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 85</bibl></cit> (17): <cit><quote lang="la">prosecuti cum donis legatos sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:55:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 55, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decedentem domum cum favore ac laudibus prosecuti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 31, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Senatus gratias egit Caesari, quod et ipse cum summo honore mentionem ejus prosecutus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem uberrimo congiario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39038.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pursue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">follow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proceed with</hi> an idea or theme: <cit><quote lang="la">si (rem) non ad extremum, sed usque eo, quo opus erit, prosequemur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non prosequar longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius vero mortis opportunitatem benevolentiā prosequamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pascua versu,</quote> <trans><tr>to describe at length</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stilo munificentiae rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut latius, quae cujusque adfectus natura sit, prosequamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:8:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:1" default="NO">2, 6, 1</bibl>: uno libello carissimam<cb n="PROS" />  mihi memoriam prosequi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 10, 3</bibl>: ex ordine domesticos motus, <hi rend="ital">to pursue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go through with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">describe in order</hi>, Flor 3, 12, 14: <cit><quote lang="la">similitudinem,</quote> <trans><tr>to follow up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 13:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to proceed</hi> with one's speaking (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">prosequitur pavitans, et ficto pectore fatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 107</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prosero: <entryFree id="n39039" type="main" key="pro_se^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-sĕro</orth>, <itype>sēvi, sătum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n39039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">produce by sowing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39039.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">segetem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 411</bibl></cit>: fruges, Tert. poët. adv. Marc. 1, 127.—</sense><sense id="n39039.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to beget</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generate</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Plato augustiore conceptu prosatus,</quote> <trans><tr>sprung from</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 1</bibl></cit>: placito dea prosata mundo, Sol. Fragm. in Anthol. Lat. t. 2, p. 384 Burm.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">venti ex aëre prosati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mund. 12, p. 62, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 7, 1</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 6, 46. —</sense><sense id="n39039.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to produce</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex artibus artes Proserere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39040" type="main" key="pro_se^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-sĕro</orth>, <itype>sĕrŭi, sertum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n39040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stretch forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aggeribus caput Alpinis proserit in Celtas (Rhodanus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:447" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 447</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proserit hydra caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 1111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Perieg. 711, 342</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proserpina: <entryFree id="n39041" type="main" key="Pro_^serpi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prō^serpĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*persefo/nh</foreign>. <sense id="n39041.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Proserpine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Ceres and Jupiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and wife of Pluto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who seized her as she was gathering flowers in Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and carried her away to the infernal regions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cereris Proserpina puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:2:18" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 34, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 391</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 146" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 146</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39041.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">the Lower World</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed me Imperiosa trahit Proserpina: vive, valeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proserpinaca: <entryFree id="n39042" type="main" key="pro_serpi^na_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōserpĭnāca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n39042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> polygonon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 4, 11, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:127" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 12, 104, § 127</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proserpinalis: <entryFree id="n39043" type="main" key="pro_serpi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōserpĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n39043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Proserpine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <trans><tr>the herb dragonwort</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proserpo: <entryFree id="n39044" type="main" key="pro_serpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-serpo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n39044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to creep forwards</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to creep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crawl along</hi> (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n39044.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">proserpens bestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 74</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=68" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 68</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">servulus proserpit leniter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 151, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de specu funesta proserpit ursa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, p. 198, 25.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, <hi rend="ital">to come forth imperceptibly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sata in lucem proserpunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39044.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to move on imperceptibly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to glide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">steal along</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">proserpit ad intima vulnus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 14, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo proserpenti occurrere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 8, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proseucha: <entryFree id="n39045" type="greek" key="pro^seucha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏseucha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">proseuxh/</foreign>, <sense id="n39045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place for prayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an oratory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:296" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 296</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 651, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prosferari: <entryFree id="n39046" type="gloss" key="prosferari"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prosferari</orth>, <itype>impetrari</itype>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 158, 11</bibl>, very dub.</entryFree>
prosiciae: <entryFree id="n39047" type="main" key="prosici^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prosicĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, v. porriciae.</entryFree>
prosicies: <entryFree id="n39048" type="hapax" key="pro_si^ci^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsĭcĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>proseco, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n39048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the flesh cut off for sacrifice</hi> (ante-class. for prosectum): prosiciem extorum in mensam porricere, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 220, 23</bibl>.— Collat. form: prosicium, quod prosecatum proicitur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=225" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 225</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
prosidens: <entryFree id="n39049" type="gloss" key="prosi^dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pro-sĭdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [sedeo], <sense id="n39049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sitting before</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 367</bibl>, n. 127.</sense></entryFree>
prosilio: <entryFree id="n39050" type="main" key="pro_si^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-sĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi</itype> (less freq. īvi or ĭi; <sense id="n39050.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">īvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 115:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 115, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 103" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 103</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">ii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 106, 1</bibl>), 4 (<hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> prosilibo for prosiliam, Auct. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 4, 19</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>salio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to leap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spring up</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n39050.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidnam hic properans prosilit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente prosiluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex tabernaculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab sede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:310" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de capitis paterni Vertice (of Minerva),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F 3, 842</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e convivio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de navi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:8:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad accusationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:2:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in publicum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec prosilit unus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39050.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. subjects, <hi rend="ital">to spring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">burst forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to start out</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">(sanguis) Emicat, et longe terebrata prosilit aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prosiliunt lacrimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:34:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 34, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prosilit scintilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:796" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 796</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castanea sponte prosiliens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 23, 25, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frutices in altitudinem prosiliunt,</quote> <trans><tr>shoot up</tr>, <tr>grow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Peloponnesi prosilit cervix,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the isthmus begins and runs out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 4, § 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39050.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39050.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To break forth</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">vaga prosiliet frenis natura remotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39050.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To</hi> <pb n="1476" /> <cb n="PROS" /> <hi rend="ital">start up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">prosilui amicum castigatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 179</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39050.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To leap to</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">attempt zealously</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eagerly</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">numquam nisi potus ad arma Prosiluit dicenda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad accusationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:5:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:2:7" default="NO">48, 2, 7</bibl>: ad munus, Cod. 10, 52, 7.</sense></entryFree>
prosistens: <entryFree id="n39051" type="hapax" key="pro_sistens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-sistens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [sisto], <sense id="n39051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">standing out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">projecting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foliis in modum radiorum prosistentibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 269, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prositus: <entryFree id="n39052" type="gloss" key="pro_si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsĭtus</orth>, <itype>propositus</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=226" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 226</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
proslambanomenos: <entryFree id="n39053" type="greek" key="proslamba^no^me^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proslambănŏmĕnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>,=<foreign lang="greek">proslambano/menos</foreign> (taken in addition), <sense id="n39053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the note</hi> A <hi rend="ital">in music</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prosocer: <entryFree id="n39054" type="main" key="pro_so^cer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-sŏcer</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wife's grandfather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuique senex Nereus prosocer esse velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor, et nurus, et pronurus, viro, et socero, et prosocero furtum facere possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:2:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erum cum prosocero meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 14</bibl></cit> (15), 8.</sense></entryFree>
prosocrus: <entryFree id="n39055" type="main" key="pro_so_^crus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-sō^crus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n39055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wife's grandmother</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prosocrus mihi uxoris meae avia est: ego illius sum progener,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:4:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 4, § 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prosodia: <entryFree id="n39056" type="greek" key="pro^so_di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏsōdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>,=<foreign lang="greek">prosw|di/a</foreign>, <sense id="n39056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the tone</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accent</hi> of a syllable (ante-class.), Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:12:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 12, 8</bibl>: accentus quas Graeci <foreign lang="greek">prosw|di/as</foreign> vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prosodiacus: <entryFree id="n39057" type="greek" key="pro^so_di^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏsōdĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>,=<foreign lang="greek">prosw|diako/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prosodial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosodiac</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">metrum, Mar. Vict. p. 2580 P.: numeri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 991</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prosopis: <entryFree id="n39058" type="greek" key="pro^so_pis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏsōpis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏsōpītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>,=<foreign lang="greek">proswpi/s</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">proswpi/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n39058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi> (pure Lat. personacia), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prosopites: <entryFree id="n39059" type="main" key="Pro^so_pi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏsōpītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district of the Delta in Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prosopon: <entryFree id="n39060" type="main" key="pro^so_pon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏsōpon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>,=<foreign lang="greek">pro/swpon</foreign>, <sense id="n39060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of herb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild-poppy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prosopopoeia: <entryFree id="n39061" type="greek" key="pro^so_po^poei^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏsōpŏpoeĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>,=<foreign lang="greek">proswpopoii+/a</foreign>. <sense id="n39061.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Personification</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:3" default="NO">1, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:69" default="NO">4, 1, 69</bibl>; 11, 1, 41; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 2, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 21, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39061.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dramatizing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad prosopopoeias irrumpunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:49" default="NO">3, 8, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prosopopoeicus: <entryFree id="n39062" type="main" key="pro^so_po^poei^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏsōpŏpoeĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prosopopoeia</etym>, <sense id="n39062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to personification</hi>, <hi rend="ital">personifying</hi> (post-class.): sermo, Firm. Error. Prof. Relig. 8.</sense></entryFree>
prospecte: <entryFree id="n39063" type="main" key="prospecte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prospectē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. prospicio <sense id="n39063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
prospectivus: <entryFree id="n39064" type="main" key="prospecti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prospectīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. prospectus</etym>, <sense id="n39064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a prospect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnishing a prospect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prospective</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fenestrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 10, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prospecto: <entryFree id="n39065" type="main" key="prospecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prospecto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>prospicio</etym>, <sense id="n39065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look forth upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look out; to look at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">view</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">see afar off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gaze upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 2</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n39065.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars ex tectis fenestrisque prospectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:813" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 813</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Campani moenia urbis prospectantes repleverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 47, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e terrā aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 26, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intenti proelium equestre prospectabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 60, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendium e turri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e puppi pontum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 651</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capitolia ab excelsā aede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:841" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 841</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prospectans maesta carinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 52</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">astris prospectantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:124" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 124</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā longissime prospectari poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39065.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39065.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To look around</hi> or <hi rend="ital">about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prospectare, ne uspiam insidiae sient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39065.4" n="2" level="3"> Of localities, <hi rend="ital">to look towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lie</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be situate towards</hi> any quarter (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">villa, quae monte summo posita Prospectat Siculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villa, quae subjectos sinus editissima prospectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septentrionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus late prospectans,</quote> <trans><tr>furnishing a wide prospect</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thermae prospicientes viam sacram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4</bibl></cit> (9), 27, 18: <cit><quote lang="la">hos (campos) ad occasum conversa prospectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:4:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:19" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:418" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 418</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39065.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39065.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To look forward to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to expect</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">to hope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look out for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">await</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">exsilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:17:section=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 17, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem de die prospectans, ecquod auxilium ab dictatore appareret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39065.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To await</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impend over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">threaten</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">te quoque fata Prospectant paria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 741</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39065.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To foresee</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">prospectandi cognitio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 24, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prospector: <entryFree id="n39066" type="main" key="prospector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prospector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39066.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">one who looks out</hi>: sicut prospector videns <cb n="PROS" /> casum proximi sui, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 11, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39066.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">one that foresees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one that arranges beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a provider</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">deus prospector humanarum necessitatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Or. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus in rebus incertis prospector,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. 16, p. 51, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 3, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prospectus: <entryFree id="n39067" type="main" key="prospectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prospectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from prospicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39068" type="main" key="prospectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prospectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>prospicio</etym>. <sense id="n39068.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a lookout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distant view</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prospect</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sterilis prospectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum saepibus prospectus impediretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 53:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 53, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non prospectu modo extra vallum adempto, sed propinquo etiam congredientium inter se conspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere prospectum ex arce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere prospectum in praeceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 13, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39068.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39068.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">view</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in prospectum populi Romani producere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:47:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 47, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam extremi essent in prospectu,</quote> <trans><tr>to be in sight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 62" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lugubris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclarus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebere prospectum navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prospectum eripiens oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 254</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39068.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">late Aequora prospectu metior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39068.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39068.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respect</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cujus rationem prospectumque Bias non habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:11:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 11, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">prospectum officii deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n39068.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Foresight</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">humanus prospectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prospeculor: <entryFree id="n39069" type="main" key="prospe^cu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pro-spĕcŭlor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n39069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39069.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look into the distance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look out</hi> (very rare): de vallo, Auct. B. Afr. 31.—</sense><sense id="n39069.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to explore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Siccium prospeculatum ad locum castris capiendum mittunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 43, 2</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n39069.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look out for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watch for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prospeculari e muris adventum imperatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prosper: <entryFree id="n39070" type="main" key="prosper"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prosper</orth>, and more freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">prospĕrus</orth>, a. <itype>um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pro-spero, answering to hope; cf. spes</etym>, <sense id="n39070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">agreeable to one's wishes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperous</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">faustus, propitius): sperem veteres pro spem dixerunt, unde et prospere dicimus, hoc est, pro spe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 171, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicium prosperum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prosperrimum augurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 8, 9, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prospera adversaque fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:37:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N.
