D. 3, 37, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnis autem viris prosperae semper omnes res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 66, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prosperae res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non jam id ago, ut prosperos exitus consequar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: successus, Liv. praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prosperrimo rerum eventu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:122:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 122, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prosperior civium amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox cecinit laudes prosperiore lyrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prosperius fatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:614" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 614</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <trans><tr>of good omen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 5, § 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:4:38" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 4, 38</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi>: prosper dicendi successus, Auct. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 693</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 5, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde est hominum generi prosperus et salutaris ille fulgor, qui dicitur Jovis,</quote> <trans><tr>propitious</tr>, <tr>favorable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit> (cited in <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 693</bibl> P.): <cit><quote lang="la">immoriens magnis non prosperus ausis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:202" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prosperus in Africam transitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">evenio</hi> (cf. prospere): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae prospera tibi evenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:42:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 42, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cetera prospera evenissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 21, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod bellum ... ut id prosperum eveniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 28, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 47, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39070.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">noctilucam. Prosperam frugum,</quote> <trans><tr>beneficial to fruits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39070.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prospĕra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">favorable circumstances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good fortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperity</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">prospera belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:782" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 782</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam mala Pompeii quam prospera mundus adoret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 708</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germani prosperis feroces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 7</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms. </sense><sense id="n39070.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pro-spĕrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">agreeably to one's wishes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">luckily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperously</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia profluenter, prospere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:18:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 18, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui ut omnia prospere evenirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 27, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 46</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves quae prosperius evolant,</quote> <trans><tr>with better augury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:6:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res eventura prosperius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:13:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:32:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 32, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: prosperrĭme geruntur omnia. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:97:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 97, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 36</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n39070.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prospĕ-rĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">favorably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunately</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1010</bibl> P. <cb n="PROS" /></sense></entryFree>
prosperatio: <entryFree id="n39071" type="gloss" key="prospe^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prospĕrātĭo</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">kateuo/dwsis</foreign>, <sense id="n39071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">good fortune</hi>, Gloss. Cyrill.</sense></entryFree>
prospere: <entryFree id="n39072" type="main" key="prospe^re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prospĕrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. prosper <sense id="n39072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
prospergo: <entryFree id="n39073" type="main" key="prospergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pro-spergo</orth>, no <sense id="n39073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>spargo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to besprinkle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haustā aquā templum prospersum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prosperitas: <entryFree id="n39074" type="main" key="prospe^ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prospĕrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prosper</etym>, <sense id="n39074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">desirable condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good fortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">success</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperity</hi> (rare but good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:36:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 36, 86</bibl></cit>: honestarum rerum, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 16, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantā prosperitate usus est valetudinis, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>such a desirable state of health</tr>, <tr>such full health</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 1</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">improborum prosperitates secundaeque res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:36:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 36, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 270, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summarum rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currentes ex voto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 22, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 14, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39074.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Joy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approbation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est prosperitatis indicium plenum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 8, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prosperiter: <entryFree id="n39075" type="main" key="prospe^ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prospĕrĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. prosper <sense id="n39075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
prospero: <entryFree id="n39076" type="main" key="prospe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prospĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>prosper</etym>. <sense id="n39076.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cause</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">to succeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to render fortunate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">happy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prosper</hi> (syn. secundo; not in Cic.): vos precor, uti populo Romano Quiritium vim victoriamque prosperetis, an old form of prayer in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut consilia sua reipublicae prosperarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos precatus, ut coepta prosperarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">patrum decreta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:18" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 18</bibl></cit>: hanc tibi veniam prospero, i. e. <hi rend="ital">make you happy with</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 4, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prosperata felicitas,</quote> <trans><tr>desired happiness</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala averruncare, bona prosperare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. 16, p. 51</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amico meo prosperabo,</quote> <trans><tr>will make my friend happy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non prosperantibus avibus,</quote> <trans><tr>the birds not giving favorable omens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui prosperavit mundari locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 10, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">via impiorum prosperatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39076.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To render favorable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">propitious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to propitiate</hi> (post-class.): prosperatus deus, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 365: <cit><quote lang="la">o Domine, bene prosperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 117</bibl></cit> (118), 25.</sense></entryFree>
prosperus: <entryFree id="n39077" type="main" key="prospe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prospĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. prosper.</entryFree>
prospex: <entryFree id="n39078" type="main" key="pro_spex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōspex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>prospicio</etym>, <sense id="n39078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one foreseeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a foreseer</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Test. Anim. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prospica: <entryFree id="n39079" type="main" key="prospi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prospĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that takes care</hi> or <hi rend="ital">provides beforehand</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 155, 24</bibl>; cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 679</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prospicienter: <entryFree id="n39080" type="main" key="pro_spi^ci^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōspĭcĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. prospicio <sense id="n39080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
prospicientia: <entryFree id="n39081" type="main" key="pro_spi^ci^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōspĭcĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prospicio</etym>. <sense id="n39081.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Foresight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forethought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precaution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilia et prospicientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Off. 1, 21</bibl>: Creatoris, id. Hexaëm. 3, 9.—* </sense><sense id="n39081.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A view;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">an appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prospicio: <entryFree id="n39082" type="main" key="pro_spi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-spĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>exi, ectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n39082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [specio]. </sense><sense id="n39082.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look forward</hi> or <hi rend="ital">into the distance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">see</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n39082.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: neque post respiciens, neque ante prospiciens, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 443, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum prospiciunt oculi,</quote> <trans><tr>do not see well</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grues volant ad prospiciendum alte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 30, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex superioribus locis prospicere in urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum,</quote> <trans><tr>to have an extensive prospect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per umbram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 733</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 353</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: longe lateque, Auct. B. Hisp. 8.—</sense><sense id="n39082.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39082.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To look out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be on the watch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer ab januā prospiciens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavorem simulans (feles) prospexit toto die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Michol prospiciens per fenestram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Off. 2, 29, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39082.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To look</hi> or <hi rend="ital">see to beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exercise foresight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look out for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take care of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide for</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ego jam prospiciam mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulere ac prospicere debemus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:58:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 58, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prospicite atque consulite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">22: ut prospicias et consulas rationibus meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulite vobis, prospicite patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo longe in posterum prospiciens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illum intellegatis non longe animo prospexisse morientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prospicite, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuebat prospiciendum, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatusconsulto prospectum est, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 4, 2</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: malo nos prospicere quam ulcisci, <pb n="1477" /> <cb n="PROS" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagae crescunt, Nisi prospicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39082.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to see afar off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to discern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">espy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39082.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam summā ab undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campos Prospexit longe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 909</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 25, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia urbis Tarpeiā de rupe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex speculis adventantem hostium classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:49:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 49, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hostium agmen inde prospicerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex edito monte cuncta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39082.8" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of situations, <hi rend="ital">to have</hi> or <hi rend="ital">command a view of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lie towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overlook</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus prospicit agros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenatio latissimum mare, amoenissimas villas prospicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 16, 15, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">freta prospiciens Tmolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 150</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 330</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39082.9" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis infans decessit, cui nihil amplius contigit quam prospicere vitam,</quote> <trans><tr>to see life from a distance</tr>, <tr>to get a glimpse of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:42" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpe est seni aut prospicienti senectutem, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>one who sees old age before him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 33:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 33, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque prospexisse castra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>life in camp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:15:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39082.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39082.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To look at attentively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gaze at</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem propter aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39082.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To foresee</hi> a thing (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">multo ante, tamquam ex aliquā speculā, prospexi tempestatem futuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">longe prospicere futuros casus rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum in posterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:28:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 28, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex imbri soles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 393</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jam ante animo prospicere possis, quibus de rebus auditurus sis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 10, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:13:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 13, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39082.13" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To look out for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitationem alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedem senectuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritum filiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi si prospectum interea aliquid est, desertae vivimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commeatus a praetore prospectos in hiemem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ferramenta prospicienda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:19:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 19, 55</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n39082.14" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōspĭcĭ-ens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">endowed with foresight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39082.15" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōspĭcĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">providently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considerately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carefully</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">res prospicienter animadversas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39082.16" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōspectē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">providently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliberately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considerately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advisedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prudently</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">decernere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhaerebit bono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. ad Maced. 55" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. ad Maced. 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prospicue: <entryFree id="n39083" type="main" key="pro_spi^cue_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōspĭcuē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. prospicuus <sense id="n39083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
prospicus: <entryFree id="n39084" type="hapax" key="pro_spi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōspĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prospicio</etym>, <sense id="n39084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">taking care</hi>: hac sibi prospicā, hac despicā, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 155, 25</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 8 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
prospicuus: <entryFree id="n39085" type="main" key="pro_spi^cu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōspĭcŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n39085.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That may be seen afar off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conspicuous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:15" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39085.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Looking forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">looking into the future</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turris illa prospicua vaticinationis munus explicuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 181, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōspĭcuē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">providently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cautiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carefully</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 112, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prospiro: <entryFree id="n39086" type="hapax" key="pro_spi_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-spīro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n39086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to breathe forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhale</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 306, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prostas: <entryFree id="n39087" type="greek" key="prostas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prostas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prosta/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a porch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vestibule</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prosterno: <entryFree id="n39088" type="main" key="pro_sterno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-sterno</orth>, <itype>strāvi, strātum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n39088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strew in front of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to strew before</hi> one; also, <hi rend="ital">to throw to the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prostrate</hi> (syn.: fundo, profligo, provolvo). </sense><sense id="n39088.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo prosternebant folia farferi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 31</bibl></cit> (al. praesternebant): <cit><quote lang="la">ceteros ruerem ... et prosternerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondere silvam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 776</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prostraturus humi corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad pedes alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 45</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">prosternere se et supplicare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:20:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 20, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his auditis prostraverant se omnes humi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem prostravit, fudit, occidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:397" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 397</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio prosternitur latis arvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:508" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telo virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:ib. 3:185" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsu equi prostratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39088.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39088.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To throw to the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subvert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia cupiditate ac furore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">31, 70</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jacet ille nunc prostratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">afflicta ct prostrata virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:52:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 52, 211</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:17:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 17, 42</bibl>: malevolorum obtrectationes, Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carminum studium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or 11</bibl></cit>: <cb n="PROS" /> se prosternere, <hi rend="ital">to demean</hi> or <hi rend="ital">debase one's self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prostrata est Philisthaea omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 14, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39088.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To prostitute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:7:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 73</bibl> (in Plin Pan. 31 the true read. is praesterni).</sense></entryFree>
prosthesis: <entryFree id="n39089" type="main" key="prosthe^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prosthĕsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/sqesis</foreign>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏthĕsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/qesis</foreign>, <sense id="n39089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grammatical figure consisting in the prefixing of a letter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">syllable to a word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosthesis;</hi> as gnatus for natus, tetuli for tuli, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prostibilis: <entryFree id="n39090" type="main" key="pro_sti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōstĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prosto</etym>, <sense id="n39090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harlot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prostitute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prostibula: <entryFree id="n39091" type="main" key="pro_sti^bu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōstĭbŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prostitute</hi>, Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 423, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prostibulum: <entryFree id="n39092" type="main" key="pro_sti^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōstĭbŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39092.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A prostitute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 21, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39092.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a male who prostitutes himself</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 199</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39092.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A brothel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 42, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:16:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 16, 24</bibl>; also, in transf. signif., id. Joel, 3, 3.</sense></entryFree>
prostituo: <entryFree id="n39093" type="main" key="pro_sti^tu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-stĭtŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>statuo</etym>. <sense id="n39093.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To place before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 177</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n39093.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To expose publicly to prostitution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prostitute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cras populo prostituam vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (meretrix) sese toto corpore prostituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:110:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 110, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudicitiam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 21, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem suam lucro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora libidinibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 9, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 20, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:3:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39093.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: famam alicujus, <hi rend="ital">to prostitute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sully</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 13, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingrato vocem foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōstĭtūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">exposed publicly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prostituted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:7:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 7, 7</bibl></cit> P.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prostitutissima lupa Larentina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōstĭtūta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a harlot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prostitute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 1, 5, § 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:172" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 63, 83, § 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:4:7 sq" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 4, 7 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 10, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 22, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Baruch, 6, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39093.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unchaste</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones prostituti ac theatrales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
prostitutio: <entryFree id="n39094" type="main" key="pro_sti^tu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōstĭtūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prostituo</etym>. <sense id="n39094.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prostitution</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 128:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 128, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39094.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a dishonoring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profaning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prostitutor: <entryFree id="n39095" type="main" key="pro_sti^tu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōstĭtūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39095.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A prostitutor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pander</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39095.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">one who dishonors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a violator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christiani sacramenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cult. Fem. 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prostitutus: <entryFree id="n39096" type="main" key="pro_sti^tu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōstĭtūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from prostituo.</entryFree>
prosto: <entryFree id="n39097" type="main" key="pro_sto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-sto</orth>, <itype>stĭti, stātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> * <sense id="n39097.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To stand forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">project</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">angellis prostantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 428</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39097.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To stand in a public place.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39097.2" n="A" level="2"> Of a seller, <hi rend="ital">to offer one's wares for sale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry on one's business</hi> (cf. propono): <cit><quote lang="la">hi (lenones) saltem in occultis locis prostant, vos in foro ipso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39097.3" n="B" level="2"> Of wares, <hi rend="ital">to be set out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exposed for sale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber prostat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39097.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to sell one's body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prostitute one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mater tua prostitisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:47" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:65" default="NO">3, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:24" default="NO">9, 24</bibl>; P. Syrus ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n39097.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud amicitiae quondam venerabile numen Prostat et in quaestu pro meretrice sedet,</quote> <trans><tr>prostitutes herself</tr>, <tr>is venal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prostomis: <entryFree id="n39098" type="greek" key="prosto^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prostŏmis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prostomi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instrument to hold a horse by the nose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a barnacle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twitch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beak;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">a drinkingvessel</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1</bibl>, n. 84 (others read postomis, q. v.).</sense></entryFree>
prostratio: <entryFree id="n39099" type="main" key="prostra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prostrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prosterno</etym>, <sense id="n39099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overthrowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subverting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prostration</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prostrator: <entryFree id="n39100" type="main" key="pro_stra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōstrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overthrower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prostrator</hi> (late Lat.): hostium, Jul. Firm. Err. Prof. Relig. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
prostratus: <entryFree id="n39101" type="main" key="pro_stra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōstrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from prosterno.</entryFree>
prostylos: <entryFree id="n39102" type="greek" key="prosty_los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prostȳlos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/stulos</foreign>, <sense id="n39102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having pillars in front</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes">7</bibl> praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
prostypum: <entryFree id="n39103" type="greek" key="prosty^pum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prostypum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/stupon</foreign>, <sense id="n39103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pattern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">model</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 43, § 152</bibl>; v. Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
prosubigo: <entryFree id="n39104" type="main" key="pro_su^bi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-sŭbĭgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> * <sense id="n39104.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To dig up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 256</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n39104.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To fashion beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina Cyclops Prosubigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:288" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 288</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n39104.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To</hi> <cb n="PROT" /> <hi rend="ital">tear down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trample on</hi>: molam pede, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 3, 130.</sense></entryFree>
prosum: <entryFree id="n39105" type="main" key="pro_sum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-sum</orth>, <itype>fŭi, prōdesse</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n39105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be useful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to do good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benefit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profit.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39105.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., constr. with <case>dat.</case>, a <hi rend="ital">subjectclause</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, rarely with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: sibi prodesse, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 6, 2</bibl> (Trag. v. 310 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nec sibi nec alteri prosunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:10:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tibi litterae meae proderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum prodest ea quae metuuntur ipsa contemnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:30:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 30, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis carum et jucundum esse maxime prodest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 5:16" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 5, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:ib. 11:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mihi fingere prodest?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:935" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 935</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam tibi prodest Aërias tentasse domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 113</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae scire magis juvat quam prodest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 106:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 106, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodesse aequom est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum altera prosunt, Cin. Fin. 3, 21, 69: studia aliena ac nihil profutura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis tamen Menenianum profuit judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:9" default="NO">11, 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nocuere sequar, fugiam quae profore credam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut prodesse volunt aut delectare poëtae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu tantum corpore prodes, Nos animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 365</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id mirum, quantum profuit ad concordiam civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in id quoque prodest, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in commune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">constantia multum prodest in amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:26:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 26, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39105.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of medicines, <hi rend="ital">to be good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be beneficial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabam voci prodesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 69, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balineum assumo, quia prodest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tormina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 63, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra ignem sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 7, 25, § 59</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra anginas tritum in poscā gargarizare prodest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n39106" type="main" key="pro_sum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsum</orth>, = prorsum, q. v.</entryFree>
prosumia: <entryFree id="n39107" type="main" key="pro_su_mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsūmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n39107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small kind of vessel for reconnoitring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a spy - boat</hi>, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 536, 11 sq.</bibl> (Com. Rel. pp. 29 and 45 Rib.); cf.: prosumia genus navigii speculatorium parvum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=226" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 226</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
prosumnus: <entryFree id="n39108" type="main" key="Prosumnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prosumnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a lewd favorite of Bacchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who showed the latter the way to the infernal regions</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prosumo: <entryFree id="n39109" type="spur" key="prosu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pro-sūmo</orth>, <itype>prosumpserit</itype>, a false read. for praesumpserit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 6</bibl>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</entryFree>
prosurgo: <entryFree id="n39110" type="main" key="prosurgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prosurgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n39110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rise up</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Serm. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prosus: <entryFree id="n39111" type="main" key="pro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. prorsus.</entryFree>
prosymna: <entryFree id="n39112" type="main" key="Pro^symna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏsymna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏsymnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*prosumna</foreign>, <sense id="n39112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country</hi> or <hi rend="ital">town of Argolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:383" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 383</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 325</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protagion: <entryFree id="n39113" type="main" key="pro_ta^gi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtăgĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n39113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a good kind of wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protagoras: <entryFree id="n39114" type="main" key="Pro_ta^go^ras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prōtăgŏras</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*prwtago/ras</foreign>, <sense id="n39114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated sophist of Abdera</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a disciple of Democritus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and an older contemporary of Socrates; he was banished from Athens on a suspicion of atheism</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 23, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 46, 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 8, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 3, 1</bibl> sqq.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prōtăgŏrīon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*prwtago/reion</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a dictum</hi> or <hi rend="ital">maxim of Protagoras</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:11:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 11, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protasis: <entryFree id="n39115" type="greek" key="pro^ta^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏtăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/tasis</foreign>. <sense id="n39115.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An assertion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proposition</hi> (pure Lat. effatum), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. p. 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39115.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The beginning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">first part of a play</hi>, Don. Ter. And. praef.</sense></entryFree>
protaticus: <entryFree id="n39116" type="greek" key="pro^ta^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏtătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">protatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">appearing in the first part of a play</hi>: persona, Don. Ter. And. praef.</sense></entryFree>
prote: <entryFree id="n39117" type="main" key="Pro_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prōtē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n39117.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Stœchades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">islands on the southern coast of Gaul</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Porquerolles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39117.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island of the Ionian Sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Proti</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protectio: <entryFree id="n39118" type="main" key="pro_tecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>protego</etym>, <sense id="n39118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering over;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">a protecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">fidei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Fug. in Persec. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Serm. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:90:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 90, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
protector: <entryFree id="n39119" type="main" key="pro_tector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39119.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a coverer;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">a protector</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">legum protectores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 17, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39119.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">one of the lifeguard</hi> or <hi rend="ital">body - guard</hi> (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">inter protectores suos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Carac. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 9</bibl>; Cod. Th. 6, 24; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1028, 2 al.</bibl> <pb n="1478" /> <cb n="PROT" /></sense></entryFree>
protectorius: <entryFree id="n39120" type="main" key="pro_tecto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtectōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>protector, II.</etym>, <sense id="n39120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the life-guard</hi> or <hi rend="ital">body-guard</hi>: dignitas, Cod. Th. 7, 20, 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 47, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protectum: <entryFree id="n39121" type="main" key="pro_tectum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>protego, I. B.</etym>, <sense id="n39121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the projecting part of a roof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the eaves</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:7:6" default="NO">47, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:25:15" default="NO">43, 25, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Maff.</author> Mus. Veron. 448, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 12, 18, § 89</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
protectus: <entryFree id="n39122" type="main" key="pro_tectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from protego.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39123" type="main" key="pro_tectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>protego</etym>, <sense id="n39123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tignorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:41" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
protego: <entryFree id="n39124" type="main" key="pro_te^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-tĕgo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n39124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cover over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi> (class.; syn.: defendo, tutor). </sense><sense id="n39124.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernacula protecta hederā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates cratibus ac pluteis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <trans><tr>to furnish with a projecting roof</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc scutis protegunt hostes,</quote> <trans><tr>to cover</tr>, <tr>protect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se umbone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 33, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput contra solem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 11, 47, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutis protecti corpora longis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 662</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">protegendi corporis memor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39124.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to put up a shed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penthouse</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">projecting roof</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">hic in suo protexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus proiciendi protegendive,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 8, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39124.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39124.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cover</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shield from danger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to defend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi> (rare and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">jacentem et spoliatum defendo et protego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 18, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad protegendum regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viros optimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem adversus criminantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:32" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dominus exercituum proteget eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Zach. 9, 15</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n39124.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to ward off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:121" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39124.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cover up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">screen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nequitiam supercilio truci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:100:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 100, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risu protectis insidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parricidii immunitatem metu majore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 8:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
protelo: <entryFree id="n39125" type="main" key="pro_te_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-tēlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>telum</etym>, <sense id="n39125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drive away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put to flight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repulse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi> (only ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n39125.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: protelare longe propellere, ex Graeco videlicet <foreign lang="greek">th=le</foreign>, quod significat longe, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=235" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 235</bibl> Müll.: equites, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 363, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanos impetu suo protelant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 363, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem patriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0146,001:ib. 363:16" default="NO"><author>Turp.</author> ib. 363, 16</bibl></cit> (Com. Rel. p. 83 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem saevidicis dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc cladem de vestris manibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 209, 36</bibl></cit>; p. 178 Bip. —</sense><sense id="n39125.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39125.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To prolong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem cautionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admonitionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litem invito judice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: annis quadraginta sexcenta milia hominum protelavit, <hi rend="ital">prolonged</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">preserved their lives</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">protelentur dies in terrā possessionis vestrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 5, 33</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n39125.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring</hi> anywhere: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in portum divinae clementiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignorantiam in occasionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Spect. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
protelum: <entryFree id="n39126" type="main" key="pro_te_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtēlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n39126.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A row of oxen</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">harnessed together for draught</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a team</hi>: protelo trini boves unum aratrum ducent, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 363, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. 363:7" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. 363, 7</bibl> and 8: <cit><quote lang="la">boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 17, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bina ternaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 18, 48, § 173</bibl></cit>; cf.: protelum, <foreign lang="greek">e)/campron</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.—</sense><sense id="n39126.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a line</hi>, <hi rend="ital">row</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succession</hi> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">protelo plagarum continuato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 531</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:190" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 190</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protendo: <entryFree id="n39127" type="main" key="pro_tendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-tendo</orth>, <itype>di, sum and tum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n39127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stretch forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to extend</hi> (not in Cic.; syn. porrigo). </sense><sense id="n39127.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 606</bibl></cit> Wagn.: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia in mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supinas manus ad genua alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem (oculorum) in aestus pelagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervicem fortiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochleae bina ceu cornua protendentes contrahentesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 32, 51, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">protentis hastis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes temo protentus in octo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consanguineam protendere dextram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:655" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praerupta protendit juga Cithaeron,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 12</bibl></cit>.—Mid., <hi rend="ital">to stretch forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to extend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter digitos medius longissime protenditur,</quote> <trans><tr>projects</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 43, 99, § 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">protenditur ad Bactros usque gens Mardorum,</quote> <trans><tr>reaches</tr>, <tr>extends</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 47</bibl></cit>: anus haec in pellis periculum protenditur, <hi rend="ital">is swelled out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distended with drink</hi>, Plaut. Fragm. ap. Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 22</bibl>.—Of a river: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad colla cornipedum protentus,</quote> <trans><tr>swollen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:387" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 387</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39127.2" n="II" level="1"> <cb n="PROT" /> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prolong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">utramvis partem in plura verba protendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 267</bibl></cit> Oud.: <cit><quote lang="la">praepositiones producere atque protendere,</quote> <trans><tr>to prolong in pronunciation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:17:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 17, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO">6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbare protendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:17:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 17, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">stretched out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lengthened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extended</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Phocis lucis in exortum protentior,</quote> <trans><tr>extending farther</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">protentior vita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
protenis: <entryFree id="n39128" type="main" key="pro_te^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtĕnis</orth>, v. protinis.</entryFree>
protensio: <entryFree id="n39129" type="main" key="pro_tensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>protendo</etym>. <sense id="n39129.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a stretching out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39129.1" n="II" level="1"> As a lit. transl. of <foreign lang="greek">pro/tasis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a proposition</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protentatus: <entryFree id="n39130" type="hapax" key="pro_tenta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-tentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [tento], <sense id="n39130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tested</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">protentatā manu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 85</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
protentus: <entryFree id="n39131" type="main" key="pro_tentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <sense id="n39131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P.a.</hi>, from protendo.</sense></entryFree>
protenus: <entryFree id="n39132" type="main" key="pro_te^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtĕnus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. protinus.</entryFree>
protermino: <entryFree id="n39133" type="main" key="pro_termi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-termĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n39133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to more forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to widen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi> the boundaries (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">fines usque et usque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 235, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessionis metas in Rhodanum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
