protero: <entryFree id="n39134" type="main" key="pro_te^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-tĕro</orth>, <itype>trīvi, trītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> * <sense id="n39134.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To drive forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver proterit aestas Interitura,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>supplants</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39134.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To tread under foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trample down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wear away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bruise</hi> (class.; syn. proculco). </sense><sense id="n39134.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines elephantis proterendos substravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">januam limā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to destroy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatus aversos proterere incipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina curru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 330</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florentia arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:791" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 791</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversum rota proterit agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:175" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmus labens proterit uvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:747" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 747</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seges torrefacta proteritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39134.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defeat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marte Poenos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">protrita hostium acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem proterere et conculcare,</quote> <trans><tr>to maltreat</tr>, <tr>abuse</tr>, <tr>trample upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 2, 22, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pati urbem proteri atque conculcari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 53, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruinā suā proteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:91:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 91, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:4:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbaram plebem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 4, 12</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P.a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worn out</hi> (by rubbing); hence, of words, <hi rend="ital">of frequent use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vulgar</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:21:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 21, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:2:1" default="NO">12, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:6" default="NO">18, 4, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proterreo: <entryFree id="n39135" type="main" key="pro_terre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-terrĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <sense id="n39135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to frighten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scare away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drive away by terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to affright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrify</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">filium Proterruisti hinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem adverso equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem jaculo parmāque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:645" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 645</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feras ardentibus facibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 208, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriā pulsus atque proterritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu a tuis aedibus vi atque armis proterritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 13, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proterritis hostibus atque in fugam conjectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proterritus: <entryFree id="n39136" type="main" key="pro_terri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōterrĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from proterreo.</entryFree>
proterve: <entryFree id="n39137" type="main" key="pro^terve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏtervē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. protervus <sense id="n39137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
protervia: <entryFree id="n39138" type="main" key="pro^tervi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏtervĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>protervus</etym>, <sense id="n39138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wantonness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudence</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 172</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">procorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Per. 22</bibl></cit>; Ambros. Interp. Job, 3, 2, 5.</sense></entryFree>
protervio: <entryFree id="n39139" type="main" key="pro^tervi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏtervĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be bold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shameless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudent</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Patient. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
protervitas: <entryFree id="n39140" type="main" key="pro^tervi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏtervĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sauciness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boldness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudence</hi> (class.): protervitas levior est quaedam contumelia, procacitas major, petulantia maxima, Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 10</bibl>: coërcere protervitatem, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 121, 15</bibl> (protervitates, acc. to Fest. s. v. redhostire, p. 270 Müll.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 12, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urit me Glycerae nitor, Urit grata protervitas,</quote> <trans><tr>forwardness</tr>, <tr>wantonness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 19, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proterviter: <entryFree id="n39141" type="main" key="pro^tervi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏtervĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. protervus <sense id="n39141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
protervus: <entryFree id="n39142" type="main" key="pro^tervus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏtervus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>protero; qs. trampling on every thing; hence</etym>, <sense id="n39142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">violent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehement.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39142.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella canis,</quote> <trans><tr>scorching</tr>, <tr>oppressive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39142.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wanton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shameless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudent</hi> (class.; generally milder than procax and petulans; v. protervitas): petulans <cb n="PROT" /> protervo animo sum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum aut factum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Satyri, turba proterva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rixae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:671" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 671</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Musa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:520" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 520</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal protervum,</quote> <trans><tr>ribald wit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:9:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretrix protervior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 30, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms, proterve and proterviter. </sense><sense id="n39142.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏtervē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n39142.4" n="1" level="3"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">boldly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wantonly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shamelessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudently</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aedes arietare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proterve iracundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 53</bibl></cit> (immoderate, superbe, Don.): <cit><quote lang="la">consectans aliquem proterve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 44, 68</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 599</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 5, 22.—</sense><sense id="n39142.5" n="2" level="3"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">boldly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with spirit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confidenter pro se et proterve loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 207</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39142.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏtervĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">boldly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wantonly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shamelessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudently</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 513, 11</bibl> (Com. v. 8 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
protesilaus: <entryFree id="n39143" type="main" key="Pro_te^si^la_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prōtĕsĭlāus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*prwtesi/laos</foreign>, <sense id="n39143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Iphiclus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Phylace in Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the husband of Laodamia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the leader of the Thessalians against Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where he was the first man killed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:19:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 19, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 103 sq" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 103 sq.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n39143.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prōtĕsĭlāēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Protesilœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
protestatio: <entryFree id="n39144" type="main" key="pro_testa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtestātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>protestor</etym>, <sense id="n39144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a declaration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protestation</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">amoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:56" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 56</bibl></cit>: veritatis suae, Hilar. Trin. 1, 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 7, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protestor: <entryFree id="n39145" type="main" key="pro_testor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-testor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n39145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtesto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 799</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to declare in public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bear witness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">testify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protest</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">praedico, protestor, non ego parricidium faciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 4:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae mihi conscius sum, protestabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Nep. Am. 2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Nep. Am. 2</bibl></cit> Mai: <cit><quote lang="la">floris species florem rerum protestatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier magno fidem praesidis protestata clamore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 252</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:20:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 20, 23</bibl>; Just. Inst. prooem. 1.—With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe protestantur, pietatis gratiā id se facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:14:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 14, § 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proteus: <entryFree id="n39146" type="main" key="Pro_teus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prōteus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*prwteu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-god who often changed his form; he was in the service of Neptune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and kept his sea-calves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:731" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 731</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:761" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 761</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 388</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:367" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 367</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Protei columnae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the boundary of Egypt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 262</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a fickle person: <cit><quote lang="la">Protea tenere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 90</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a cunning person,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 71</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protheorema: <entryFree id="n39147" type="greek" key="pro^the^o_re_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏthĕōrēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">proqew/rhma</foreign>, <sense id="n39147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a considering beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preconsideration</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 138</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prothesis: <entryFree id="n39148" type="main" key="pro^the^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏthĕsis</orth>, v. prosthesis.</entryFree>
prothoenor: <entryFree id="n39149" type="main" key="Pro^tho^e_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏthŏēnor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hero at the wedding of Perseus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prothyme: <entryFree id="n39150" type="greek" key="pro^thy_me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏthȳmē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">proqu/mws</foreign>, <sense id="n39150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">willingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gladly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with pleasure;</hi> only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prothymia: <entryFree id="n39151" type="greek" key="pro^thy_mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏthȳmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">proqumi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n39151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">readiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">willingness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclination</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 11</bibl>; Marc. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. 2, 5</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
prothyra: <entryFree id="n39152" type="greek" key="pro^thy^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏthyra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/qura</foreign>. <sense id="n39152.0" n="I" level="1"> In a Grecian house, <hi rend="ital">the space before the door</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the vestibule</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39152.1" n="II" level="1"> In a Roman house, <hi rend="ital">a railing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wicket before the door</hi>, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dia/qura</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prothyris: <entryFree id="n39153" type="main" key="pro^thy^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏthyris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">proquri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ornament over a door</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pillars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> ancon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
protinam: <entryFree id="n39154" type="main" key="pro_ti^nam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtĭnam</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prōtĕnam</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>protinus</etym>, <sense id="n39154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">forthwith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">protinam a protinus, continuitatem significans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=107" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 107</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">exinde me illico protinam dedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 84</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 13</bibl>; Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 376, 13</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 12 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
protinis: <entryFree id="n39155" type="main" key="pro_ti^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtĭnis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prōtĕnis</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">forthwith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi> (ante-class.). Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 376, 6</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 178 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
protinus: <entryFree id="n39156" type="main" key="pro_ti^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-tĭnus</orth> (less properly <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-tĕnus</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>tenus</etym>, <sense id="n39156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">before one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farther on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">onward.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39156.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: statim, continuo, actutum): praecepisse, ut pergeret protinus, quid retro atque a tergo fieret, ne laboraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 49</bibl></cit>: ipse capellas Protinus aeger ago, <pb n="1479" /> <cb n="PROT" /> <hi rend="ital">drive along before me</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā (voce) protinus omne Contremuit nemus,</quote> <trans><tr>far and wide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 513</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39156.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39156.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Right on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continuously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninterruptedly</hi> (rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n39156.4" n="1" level="3"> In space, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trans Lygios Gothones regnantur . . . protinus deinde ab Oceano Rugii et Lemovii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa (vertebra) protinus caput sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39156.5" n="2" level="3"> In time or order: <cit><quote lang="la">post ad oppidum hoc vetus continuo mecum exercitum protinus obducam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 376, 28</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Tubero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 376, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">protinus ut moneam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trajecto missa lacerto Protinus hasta fugit servatque cruenta tenorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 340</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">felix si protinus illum Aequasset nocti ludum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 337</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39156.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Forthwith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">directly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from the very first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the spot</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">but rare in prose until post-Aug. per.): oratio protinus perficiens auditorem benevolum,</quote> <trans><tr>at the very outset</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:15:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 15, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes protinus ex eo loco ad flumen contenderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu protinus unde Divitias aerisque ruam, dic, augur, acervos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 21</bibl></cit>.—With a <hi rend="ital">negative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non protinus,</quote> <trans><tr>not immediately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi> or <hi rend="ital">directly after</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex fugā protinus auxilia discesserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">protinus ab ipsā curatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a partu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab adoptione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:104:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 104, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">protinus post cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 26</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as soon as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as soon as ever;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">protinus ut percussus est aliquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 3</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 28, 40, § 75</bibl> (al. quā); 15, 17, 18, § 67.—With <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">Protinus ad censum, de moribus ultima flet quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:140" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
protocomium: <entryFree id="n39157" type="main" key="pro_to^co^mi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtŏcŏmĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prwtoko/mion</foreign>, <sense id="n39157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the place where the hair begins</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 11</bibl> dub. (al. procomion).</sense></entryFree>
protogenes: <entryFree id="n39158" type="main" key="Pro_to^ge^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prōtŏgĕnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*prwtoge/nhs</foreign>, <sense id="n39158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Grecian painter of Caunus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the coast of Caria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 21, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:31" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
protollo: <entryFree id="n39159" type="main" key="pro_tollo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-tollo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n39159.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To stretch forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pleiadas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 567</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39159.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39159.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To prolong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defer</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 159, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam in crastinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem sibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feturam mulierum non ultra decimum mensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39159.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To elevate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox a minore solita ad majorem protolli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 7, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
protomedia: <entryFree id="n39160" type="greek" key="pro_to^me_di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtŏmēdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prwtomhdi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n39160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an herb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 185</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protomysta: <entryFree id="n39161" type="greek" key="pro_to^mysta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtŏmysta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prwtomu/sths</foreign>, <sense id="n39161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chief priest in mystic ceremonies</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protono: <entryFree id="n39162" type="hapax" key="proto^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pro-tŏno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n39162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thunder forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tali protonat ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:205" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 205</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
protoplastus: <entryFree id="n39163" type="greek" key="pro_to^_plastus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtŏ_plastus</orth> (prŏtoplastus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 2, 35</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prwtoplasto/s</foreign> (first-formed), <sense id="n39163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first man;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the first men</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. ad Castit. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Jud. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 2, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protopraxia: <entryFree id="n39164" type="greek" key="pro_topraxi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtopraxĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prwtopraci/a</foreign>, <sense id="n39164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the privilege of being preferred to other creditors</hi>, = jus primae exactionis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protosedeo: <entryFree id="n39165" type="main" key="pro_to^se^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtŏsĕdĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">prw=tos</foreign>-sedeo</etym>, <sense id="n39165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sit in the first place</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protostasia: <entryFree id="n39166" type="greek" key="pro_tosta^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtostăsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prwtostasi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n39166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of chief collector of taxes in the</hi> municipia, <hi rend="ital">the chief collectorship</hi>, Cod. Th. 11, 23, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 10, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prototomus: <entryFree id="n39167" type="greek" key="pro_to^to^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtŏtŏmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">prwto/tomos</foreign>, <sense id="n39167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is cut off first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the first cutting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caules,</quote> <trans><tr>the earliest cabbage - sprouts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:369" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 369</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 137</bibl>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">coliculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:101" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 101</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39167.1" n="2" level="3"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-tŏtŏmi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">cabbages of the first cutting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:16" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prototypia: <entryFree id="n39168" type="greek" key="pro_to^ty^pi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtŏtypĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prwtotupi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n39168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of one who has charge of the commutation for recruits</hi>, Cod. Th. 6, 35; 11, 23.</sense></entryFree>
prototypus: <entryFree id="n39169" type="greek" key="pro_to^ty^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtŏtypus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">prwto/tupos</foreign>, <sense id="n39169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">original</hi>, <hi rend="ital">primitive</hi> (post-class.): metra, <hi rend="ital">standard metre</hi>, Mar. Vict. p. 2552 P.</sense></entryFree>
protracte: <entryFree id="n39170" type="main" key="pro_tracte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtractē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>protractus</etym>, <sense id="n39170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with the</hi> <cb n="PROT" /> <hi rend="ital">time dragged</hi> (late Lat.; music. t. t.), Pauli et Steph. Reg. ad Mon. 7.</sense></entryFree>
protractio: <entryFree id="n39171" type="main" key="pro_tracti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtractĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>protraho</etym>, <sense id="n39171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lengthening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protraction</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protractus: <entryFree id="n39172" type="main" key="pro_tractus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from protraho.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39173" type="gloss" key="pro_tractus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtractus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>protraho</etym>, <sense id="n39173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prolonging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protraction</hi>: LONGI, Inscr. Amadut. Anecd. Litt. 2, p. 480.</sense></entryFree>
protraho: <entryFree id="n39174" type="main" key="pro_tra^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-trăho</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype> (sync. form protraxtis for protraxistis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:84" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 84</bibl>.—<sense id="n39174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Inf.</hi> protraxe for protraxisse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1159</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drag forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pull out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to draw</hi> to a place (class.; cf.: promo, profero). </sense><sense id="n39174.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem e tentorio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me istam capillo protracturum in viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem hinc in convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Calchanta in medios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in medium manibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad operas mercenarias statim protrahi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibusque informe cadaver (Caci) Protrahitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa siti protracta corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e tentorio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39174.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39174.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to drag forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring</hi> anywhere: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad gestum pueros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1031" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1031</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid paulatim protrahit aetas In medium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1387</bibl></cit> dub. (v. Lachm. II. p. 346): <cit><quote lang="la">indicem ad indicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudi in medium protrahebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 29</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n39174.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39174.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring to light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reveal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betray</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctorem nefandi facinoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus per indicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicanorum fraudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:92:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 92, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec meus indicio latitantes versus amicus Protraheret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:71" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39174.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lengthen out</hi> any thing as to time, <hi rend="ital">to prolong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defer</hi> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: produco, propago): protrahere ac differre stipendia militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia in primam lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">epulas a medio die ad mediam noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in serum dimicatione protractā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 20, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> in mid. force: quid diutius protrahor? <hi rend="ital">why dwell longer</hi> on this? <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Tac. 6</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinque horas protraxit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>he lingered for five hours</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n39174.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To weary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detain</hi> too long: <cit><quote lang="la">ne diutius te protraham,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 24, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39174.8" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">utrum hoc usque ad Graecum sermonem tantum protrahimus, an verum et ad alium ... dubitari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit> (al. pertraheret).—</sense><sense id="n39174.9" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reduce to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad paupertatem protractus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 72</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
protrepticon: <entryFree id="n39175" type="greek" key="protrepti^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">protreptĭcon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">protreptiko/n</foreign>, <sense id="n39175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an exhortation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hortatory</hi> or <hi rend="ital">protreptical discourse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 4 praef.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protrico: <entryFree id="n39176" type="gloss" key="protri_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pro-trīco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n39176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make difficulties beforehand</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protrimentum: <entryFree id="n39177" type="main" key="pro_tri_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtrīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>protero</etym>, <sense id="n39177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dish composed of various ingredients hashed together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ragout</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 216</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protritus: <entryFree id="n39178" type="main" key="pro_tri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōtrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from protero.</entryFree>
protropum: <entryFree id="n39179" type="greek" key="pro^tro^pum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏtrŏpum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/tropon</foreign>, <sense id="n39179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first new wine that runs from the grapes before pressing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cnidium,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
protrudo: <entryFree id="n39180" type="main" key="pro_tru_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-trūdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n39180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thrust</hi> or <hi rend="ital">push forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to thrust forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">push out</hi> (class.; syn.: proturbo, propello). </sense><sense id="n39180.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">moles protruditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:891" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 891</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:246" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 246</bibl> and 280: <cit><quote lang="la">cylindrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 19, 43</bibl></cit>: is . . . domo atque nostrā familiā protruditur, Afran. ap. Don. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> 3, 4, 34</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 174 Rib.; cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:II. p. 121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> II. p. 121</bibl>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">protrudi penatibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to be thrust out of doors</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39180.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of time, <hi rend="ital">to put off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitia in Januarium mensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 26, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
protubero: <entryFree id="n39181" type="main" key="pro_tu_be^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-tūbĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n39181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swell</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bulge out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow forth</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n39181.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">densa ne supra modum protuberent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 13</bibl></cit>, praef. § 8; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protumidus: <entryFree id="n39182" type="hapax" key="pro_tu^mi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-tŭmĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n39182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swollen in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protuberant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gibbous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 42, 1</bibl></cit>. <cb n="PROV" /></sense></entryFree>
proturbo: <entryFree id="n39183" type="main" key="pro_turbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-turbo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n39183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drive forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to repel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repulse</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n39183.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">his facile pulsis ac proturbatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes telis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes pigras et ignavas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 19, 21, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra tecta proturbantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de domo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 230, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem laribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 513</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem Missilibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:801" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 801</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes hinc comminus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 441</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exsilium proturbatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvas,</quote> <trans><tr>to bear down</tr>, <tr>overthrow</tr>, <tr>prostrate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39183.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">anhelatum murmur pectore,</quote> <trans><tr>to send forth</tr>, <tr>utter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:605" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum conviciis proturbatus,</quote> <trans><tr>attacked</tr>, <tr>assailed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuncius hunc (Aeolum) solio Boreas proturbat ab alto,</quote> <trans><tr>drives him from his lofty seat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:597" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 597</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
protutela: <entryFree id="n39184" type="main" key="pro_tu_te_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-tūtēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n39184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vice-guardianship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vice-tutelage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:5:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:24" default="NO">8, 3, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
protypum: <entryFree id="n39185" type="spur" key="pro^ty^pum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏtypum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, a false read. for prostypum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 43, § 152</bibl>.</entryFree>
protyrum: <entryFree id="n39186" type="main" key="pro^ty^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏtyrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n39186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wine made in the island of Lesbos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prout: <entryFree id="n39187" type="main" key="prout"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pro-ut</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. pro, I.</entryFree>
provectibilis: <entryFree id="n39188" type="main" key="pro_vecti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvectĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>proveho</etym>, <sense id="n39188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">capable of progress</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Cont. Virg. p. 747</bibl> Stav.</sense></entryFree>
provectio: <entryFree id="n39189" type="main" key="pro_vecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an advancement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promotion</hi> (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 11, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
provector: <entryFree id="n39190" type="main" key="pro_vector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promoter</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 6, 17.</sense></entryFree>
provectus: <entryFree id="n39191" type="main" key="pro_vectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from proveho.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39192" type="main" key="pro_vectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>proveho</etym> (postclass.). <sense id="n39192.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Advancement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promotion</hi> to places of honor: <cit><quote lang="la">honestiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 39" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n39192.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Progress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furtherance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesentia domini provectus est agri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 4, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
provegeo: <entryFree id="n39193" type="spur" key="pro_ve^ge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-vĕgĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, a false read. for probito.</entryFree>
proveho: <entryFree id="n39194" type="main" key="pro_ve^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-vĕho</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n39194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conduct forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to carry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">convey along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transport</hi>, etc., to a place; and freq. <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> in mid. signif., <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sail</hi>, etc., to a place (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n39194.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam pol provexi: avehere non quivi,</quote> <trans><tr>I took her on board the ship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvos apum mulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 13, 43, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër a tergo quasi provehat atque propellat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1026" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1026</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum classe freto provehi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">provehimur portu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc se provecti deserto in litore condunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 31, 36, § 199</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">provectus equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a terrā provectae naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves provectae in altum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n39194.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to carry on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">along</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lead on; to promote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exalt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquo te tua virtus provexisset?</quote> <trans><tr>promoted</tr>, <tr>exalted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summos honores alios scientia juris provexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 40, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam infimi generis ad amplissimos honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 72</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in consulatūs, censuras et triumphos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:128" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 128</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">studiosos amat, fovet, provehit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim temperatam di quoque provehunt In majus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 66</bibl></cit>: haec spes provexit, ut ad conspecta procul pecora decurrerent, <hi rend="ital">carried them so far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brought them to such a pitch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50, 5</bibl>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illo etiam (forsitan pravo) gaudio provehente, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem e gregario milite Alexander virtutis causā provexerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:4:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (reges) ad fastigium majestatis spectata moderatio provehebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos provexerat, fortuna destitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in consulare provectus fuerat vestigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:69:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 69, 1</bibl></cit>: vitam in altum, qs. <hi rend="ital">to drive it into a sea</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">into disquietude</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1434</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39194.3" n="B" level="2"> Mid., <hi rend="ital">to advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go onwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make progress</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne videlicet ultra quam homini datum est nostra provehantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">10: sentio me esse longius provectum quam proposita ratio postularet,</quote> <trans><tr>have been carried farther</tr>, <tr>have gone farther</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si qui longius in amicitiā provecti essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 10, 34</bibl></cit>: provectus longius quam voluit, id. Har. <pb n="1480" /> <cb n="PROV" /> Resp. 20, 43: <cit><quote lang="la">imbecillitas in altum provehitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:18:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provehi in maledicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per altercationem ad continuas et infestas orationes provecti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39194.4" n="2" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">to draw out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolong</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ultra Provehor?</quote> <trans><tr>why do I say more?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 481</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> of time, <hi rend="ital">advanced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum colere coepi non admodum grandem natu, sed tamen jam aetate provectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provectā aetate mortua est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provecta nox erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aetate jam provectus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectute provectior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 195</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equis provectioribus tempora cavari incipiunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis provectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 18, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
provendo: <entryFree id="n39195" type="spur" key="pro_vendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-vendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, a false read. for protruditur, Afran. ap. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 34</bibl>; cf. Com. Rel. p. 174 Rib.; Lachm. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 121</bibl>; and v. protrudo.</entryFree>
provenio: <entryFree id="n39196" type="main" key="pro_ve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>vēni, ventum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n39196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to come forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear</hi> (not in Cic.; syn. appareo). </sense><sense id="n39196.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39196.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (mostly anteclass.): proveniebant oratores novi, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 20</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 14 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">scriptorum magna ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in scenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus feminis menstrua non proveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39196.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39196.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To come forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be brought forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be born; to originate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be produced</hi> (post-Aug.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">progigno): deductis olim, quique mox provenere, haec patria est,</quote> <trans><tr>were born</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque Artemenem Dario provenisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:10:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec aliud ibi animal provenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 10, 12, § 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:152" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 54, 75, § 152</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula, in quā candidum plumbum provenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 16, 30, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:773" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 773</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 1, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic neque fistulosus (caseus) neque salsus neque aridus provenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39196.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To grow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrive</hi> (so in Cæs. and Livy; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">redeo): frumentum propter siccitates angustius provenerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 13, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgas roscidas si recideris, parum prospere proveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:30:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 30, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:2:4" default="NO">1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:2" default="NO">3, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 7, 36, § 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores sponte suā provenientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum provenisset segetum copia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:12:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 12, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39196.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39196.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to come forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">malum maximum, si id provenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39196.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39196.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To spring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arise; to come to pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to happen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occur</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">accido, evenio): carmina proveniunt animo deducta sereno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:39" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex studiis gaudium, sic studia hilaritate proveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandro simile provenisset ostentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provenire certa ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39196.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To go on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi> in any manner; <hi rend="ital">to succeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flourish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn out</hi>: decumae proveniunt male, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 521, 3</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of personal subjects, to whom any thing turns out in any manner: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tu recte provenisti,</quote> <trans><tr>since it has turned out well with you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 22</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nequiter multis modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Phil. 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novā ubertate provenire terram,</quote> <trans><tr>flourish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 12, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39196.11" n="b" level="4"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to go on well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prosper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeed</hi>, = succedere: <cit><quote lang="la">si destinata provenissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si consilium provenisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provenere dominationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut proveniant sine malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut initia belli provenissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proventus: <entryFree id="n39197" type="main" key="pro_ventus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōventus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>provenio</etym>, <sense id="n39197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coming forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">growing up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">growth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase; produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crop</hi> (not in Cic.; syn. reditus). </sense><sense id="n39197.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">proventu oneret sulcos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">papilionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 5, 11, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 21, 19, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 12, 48, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uberi vinearum proventu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus trifero proventu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 19, § 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:33:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 33, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 114, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">equinus proventus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 45, 5</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 18, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 24, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:189" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 12, 62, § 189</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39197.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a supply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">number</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum deinde efflorescat... oratorum ingens proventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarorum virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:1:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 65, 85, § 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuniculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 55, 81, § 218</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39197.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39197.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an issue</hi>, <cb n="PROV" /> <hi rend="ital">result</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">errare, si qui in bello omnis secundos rerum proventus expectent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
