G. 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes milites intenti pugnae proventum expectabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus peregrinationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 120, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39197.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a fortunate issue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happy result</hi>, <hi rend="ital">success</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">superioris temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 10, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proverbialis: <entryFree id="n39198" type="main" key="pro_verbi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōverbĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>proverbium</etym>, <sense id="n39198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">proverbial</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 24</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōverbĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">proverbially</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl>; Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proverbium: <entryFree id="n39199" type="main" key="pro_verbi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōverbĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pro-verbum</etym>. <sense id="n39199.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An old saying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a saw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maxim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proverb</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. adagium): ex quo illud factum est jam tritum sermone proverbium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proverbii consuetudinem venire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud in proverbium venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est Graecis hominibus in proverbio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:20:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 20, § 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:70:235" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 70, 235</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod proverbii loco dici solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proverbii locum obtinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:16:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 16, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta agimus, quod vetamur veteri proverbio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 22, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut proverbium loquitur vetus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 12</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">in communibus proverbiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:46:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 46, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proverbia opportune aptata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:97" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 97</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n39199.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A byword</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a subject of contemptuous reference</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">et eris perditus in proverbium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:28:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 28, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3 Reg. 9, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proversus: <entryFree id="n39200" type="main" key="pro_versus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōversus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from proverto.</entryFree>
proverto: <entryFree id="n39201" type="main" key="pro_verto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-verto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vorto</orth>), no <sense id="n39201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, sum, 3, <hi rend="ital">v.a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn forwards</hi> (ante-class.): ut transversus, non proversus cedit, quasi cancer solet, <hi rend="ital">turned forwards</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">straightforwards</hi>, Plaut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 81</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">provorsum fulgur appellatur, quod ignoratur noc tu an interdiu sit factum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=229" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 229</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
provide: <entryFree id="n39202" type="main" key="pro_vi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. providus <sense id="n39202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
providens: <entryFree id="n39203" type="main" key="pro_vi^dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvĭdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <sense id="n39203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P.a.</hi>, from provideo.</sense></entryFree>
providenter: <entryFree id="n39204" type="main" key="pro_vi^denter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvĭdenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>provideo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> A. <sense id="n39204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
providentia: <entryFree id="n39205" type="main" key="pro_vi^denti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvĭdentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>provideo</etym>. <sense id="n39205.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Foresight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreknowledge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">providentia est, per quam futurum aliquid videtur ante quam factum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:53:160" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 53, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timoris tormentum memoria reducit, providentia anticipat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 5:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39205.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Foresight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forethought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forecast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precaution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">providence</hi> (cf. prudentia): <cit><quote lang="la">deorum providentiā mundum administrari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:51:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 51, 117</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 22, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum ex providentiā timorem afferre solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimum tibi et usus et providentiae superest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam te providentia deorum primum in locum provexerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:10:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 10, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">object. gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque feriendi neque declinandi providentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">providentia filiorum suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:1:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">agnosce bonitatem dei ex providentiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n39205.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39205.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The government of the world by infinite wisdom and foresight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">providence</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tua, Pater, providentia gubernat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 14, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 24, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39205.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Providence</hi>, as a designation of <hi rend="ital">the Deity</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vis illum (deum) providentiam dicere? recte dices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:45:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 45, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio, quā nihil praestantius homini dedit providentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:19" default="NO">1, 12, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO">6</bibl> praef. § 4; 5, 12, 19; 10, 1, 109; 12, 1, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 179, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39205.5" n="3" level="3"> Providentia, <hi rend="ital">Providence</hi>, personified as <hi rend="ital">a goddess</hi>, a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*pro/noia</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
provideo: <entryFree id="n39206" type="main" key="pro_vi^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-vĭdĕo</orth>, <itype>vīdi, vīsum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n39206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39206.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39206.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to see forwards</hi> or <hi rend="ital">before one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to see in the distance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to discern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descry</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi, quid petatur, procul provideri nequeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:35:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 35, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39206.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39206.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be provident</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cautious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to act with foresight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take care</hi> (rare but class.; syn. praecaveo): actum de te est, nisi provides. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 18, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi providisses, tibi ipsi pereundum fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:61:section=157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 61, § 157</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39206.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To see to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">care for; to provide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make preparation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">provision for</hi> any thing (freq. and class.); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: multum in posterum providerunt,<cb n="PROV" />  quod, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 33, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil me curassis, ego mihi providero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei frumentariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condicioni omnium civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut consulas omnibus, ut provideas saluti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:10:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 10, § 31</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a dis vitae hominum consuli et provideri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est autem de Brundusio providendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 11, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de re frumentariā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de frumento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quam rectissime agantur omnia providebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:17:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 17, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura et provide, ne quid ei desit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne qua civitas suis finibus recipiat, a me provisum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">provisum est, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provisum atque praecautum est, ne quid, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39206.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39206.7" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to see</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perceive in the distance</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nave provisā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39206.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39206.9" n="1" level="3"> In respect of time, <hi rend="ital">to see</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perceive beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to foresee; to see before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">earlier</hi> (class.): si qui, quae eventura sunt, provideant, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:34" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 34</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 407 Rib.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:14:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 14, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem, quam mens providit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:884" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 884</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego, priusquam loqui coepisti, sensi atque providi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicus morbum ingravescentem ratione providet, insidias imperator, tempestates gubernator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">providere, quid futurum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod adhuc conjecturā provideri possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas ante provisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio explorata atque provisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:6:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 6, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hercle te provideram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39206.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To see to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">care for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give attention to; to prepare</hi> or <hi rend="ital">provide for</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">eas cellas provident, ne habeant in solo umorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:10:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut res tempusque postulat, provideas atque administres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">providentia haec potissimum providet, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:22:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 22, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae ad usum navium pertinerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem frumentariam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frumento exercitui proviso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provisi ante commeatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbaque provisam rem non invita sequentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae multo ante memoi provisa repones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 167</bibl></cit>; cf.: providebam Dominum in conspectu meo, <hi rend="ital">kept in view</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in mind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 15, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39206.11" n="3" level="3"> Providere aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to prevent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obviate</hi> an evil (syn. cavere): <cit><quote lang="la">neque omnino facere aut providere quicquam poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 99:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 99, 2</bibl></cit> Kritz: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid provideri potest, provide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae consilio provideri poterunt, cavebuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 6, 14, § 30</bibl> Sillig; 34, 7, 18, § 40; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 6</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n39206.12" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvĭ-dens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">foreseeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prudent</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo multum providens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id est providentius,</quote> <trans><tr>more prudent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">providentissimus quisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvĭdenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with foresight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">providently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prudently</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 90:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 90, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 3, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto melius quanto providentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 14:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 14, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">providentissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:40:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 40, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 61</bibl> (69), 1; 10, 77 (81), 1.—*</sense><sense id="n39206.13" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvīsō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">with foresight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forethought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prudently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temere, proviso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
providus: <entryFree id="n39207" type="main" key="pro_vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>provideo</etym>. <sense id="n39207.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Foreseeing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens provida rerum futurarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:57:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 57, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec eum provida futuri, fefellit opinio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:12" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri providus augur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec futuri providus est nec praeteriti memor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:35" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39207.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Cautious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumspect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prudent</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">cautus, consideratus): homines parum cauti providique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animal hoc providum, sagax ... quem vocamus hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator prudens et providus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispice, ne sit parum providum, sperare ex aliis, quod tibi ipse non praestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Ulixes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39207.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Caring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">providing for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provident of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura consultrix et provida utilitatum oportunitatumque omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:22:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 22, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum vestrarum providus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera providae sollertisque naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51, 28</bibl></cit>: <pb n="1481" /> <cb n="PROV" /> provida cura ducis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:60" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 60</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prudently</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">provide eligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 50, § 97</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
provincia: <entryFree id="n39208" type="main" key="pro_vinci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvincĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (old <sense id="n39208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> PROVINCIAI, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 376, 6</bibl>) [etym. dub.; perh. contr. for pro-noventia (cf. nuntius), the charge or government of a legate]. </sense><sense id="n39208.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A province</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a territory out of Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquired by the Romans</hi> (chiefly by conquest), <hi rend="ital">and brought under Roman government;</hi> freq., also, to be rendered <hi rend="ital">provincial administration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employment</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicilia prima omnium provincia est appellata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defendo provinciam Siciliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia Syria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asia provincia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 34, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia Gallia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeponere, praeficere aliquem provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tradere alicui provinciam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in provinciam cum imperio proficisci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">administrare provinciam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam consulari imperio obtinere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 34, 85</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 8, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de provinciā decedere,</quote> <trans><tr>to retire from the administration of a province</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam Lentulus deposuit,</quote> <trans><tr>gave up</tr>, <tr>resigned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:21:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 21, 50</bibl></cit>: provincia consularis, <hi rend="ital">governed by a former consul</hi> (proconsul), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:13:section=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 13, § 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetoria,</quote> <trans><tr>governed by a former prœtor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 8, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39208.2" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a province</hi>, <hi rend="ital">division of a kingdom</hi> or <hi rend="ital">empire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Judaea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Esdr. 5, 8: <cit><quote lang="la">Babylonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dan. 2, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39208.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">official duty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">office</hi>, <hi rend="ital">business</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">province</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">parasitorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc tibi impero provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi in tuam provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duram capere provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi provinciam depoposcit, ut me in meo lectulo trucidaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 18, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui eam provinciam susceperint, ut in balneas contruderentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicinio Volsci, Aquilio Hernici provincia evenit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>were given into his charge</tr>, <tr>were assigned to him to be subdued</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ambo consules Appuliam provinciam haberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 22</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi inter se provincias partiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:35" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
provincialis: <entryFree id="n39209" type="main" key="pro_vinci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvincĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>provincia</etym>, <sense id="n39209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a province</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provincial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">administratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:15:section=43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 15, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia,</quote> <trans><tr>the administration of a province</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">20: edictum,</quote> <trans><tr>belonging to a province</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:46:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 46, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestia,</quote> <trans><tr>arising from the administration of a province</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abstinentia,</quote> <trans><tr>observed in the administration of a province</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta et commoda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parsimonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus ad me minime provinciales,</quote> <trans><tr>not as they usually are with provincial administrators</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39209.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvincĭālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of a province;</hi> mostly in <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the people of a province</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provincials</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 5, § 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:190" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 190</bibl>. —Opp. to the inhabitants of Italy: <cit><quote lang="la">Italicus es an provincialis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 9</bibl>; cf. as <pos>adj.</pos>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
provinciatim: <entryFree id="n39210" type="hapax" key="pro_vinci^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvincĭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">through the provinces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">province by province</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones provinciatim distribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 4, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
provinco: <entryFree id="n39211" type="main" key="pro_vinco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-vinco</orth>, <itype>vīci, victum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n39211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to conquer before</hi>, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. Provinciae, p. 226 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
provindemiator: <entryFree id="n39212" type="main" key="pro_vinde_mi^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-vindēmĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a star over the right shoulder of Virgo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which rises just before the vintage; called also</hi> Vindemiatrix, Vindemiator, Vindemitor, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">protrughth/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4, 1</bibl> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. provindemia).</sense></entryFree>
provisio: <entryFree id="n39213" type="main" key="pro_vi_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvīsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>provideo</etym>. <sense id="n39213.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A foreseeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreknowing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">provisio animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:14:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 14, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39213.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Foresight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">providence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus longā animi provisione fugiendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:189" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 56, 189</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39213.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Forethought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precaution</hi> for a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">posteri temporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 20, 69</bibl></cit>: annonaria, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a providing with provisions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purveying</hi>, Treb. XXX. Tyrann. 18.—</sense><sense id="n39213.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Hindrance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevention</hi> of a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">horum incommodorum una cautio est atque una provisio, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 78</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proviso: <entryFree id="n39214" type="main" key="pro_vi_so_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvīsō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. provideo <sense id="n39214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39215" type="main" key="pro_vi_so2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-vīso</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n39215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <cb n="PROV" /> <hi rend="ital">come forth to see</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">proviso, quid agat Pamphilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc proviso, ut, ubi tempus siet, Deducam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 6, 1</bibl> (proviso duas res significat: procedo et video, Don.).—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quem hominem exspectant, eum solent provisere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be on the lookout for him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
provisor: <entryFree id="n39216" type="main" key="pro_vi_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvīsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>provideo</etym>. * <sense id="n39216.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A foreseer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingruentium dominationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39216.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A provider</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilium tardus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">PROVISORI. EIVSDEM. PROVINCIAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ORDINIS (decurionum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3766</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
provisus: <entryFree id="n39217" type="main" key="pro_vi_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from provideo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39218" type="main" key="pro_vi_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvīsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (only in <sense id="n39218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>provideo</etym> (Tacitean). * </sense><sense id="n39218.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A looking before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">looking into the distance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne oculi quidem provisu juvabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 22</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39218.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n39218.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A foreseeing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39218.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A caring for</hi> or <hi rend="ital">furnishing beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precaution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">providing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">providence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispositu provisuque civilium rerum peritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei frumentariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curā, provisu deinde agere ac si hostis ingrueret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
provivo: <entryFree id="n39219" type="hapax" key="pro_vi_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-vīvo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n39219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to live on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam spe sustentatam provixisse reor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
provocabilis: <entryFree id="n39220" type="main" key="pro_vo^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvŏcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>provoco</etym>, <sense id="n39220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">easily aroused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excitable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">motus liquidorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:21:198" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 21, 198</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
provocabulum: <entryFree id="n39221" type="hapax" key="pro_vo^ca_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-vŏcābŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n39221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a word that is used for another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pronoun</hi>, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 45</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
provocaticius: <entryFree id="n39222" type="main" key="pro_vo^ca_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvŏcātīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>provoco</etym>, <sense id="n39222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">called forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excited</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">animatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
provocatio: <entryFree id="n39223" type="main" key="pro_vo^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvŏcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39223.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A calling out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">challenging</hi> to combat (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex provocatione hostem interemit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:12:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:101" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 28, 29, § 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:12" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 1, 4, § 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39223.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A stimulus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provocation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encouragement</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">in provocationem caritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 10, 24</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n39223.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A citation before a higher tribunal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an appeal</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad populum provocatio esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Publicola legem ad populum tulit ... ne quis magistratus civem Romanum adversus provocationem necaret neve verberaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 36, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 37, 62</bibl>; 3, 32, 44; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:48:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 48, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 13, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">provocationem interponere,</quote> <trans><tr>to appeal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:1:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est provocatio,</quote> <trans><tr>an appeal lies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellatio provocatioque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 56</bibl></cit> et saep.; Plin. praef. § 10.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">provocationes omnium rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 40, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
provocativus: <entryFree id="n39224" type="main" key="pro_vo^ca_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvŏcātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">called forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elicited</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n39224.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crementa animae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 37</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n39224.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calling forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eliciting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:4:40" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 4, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
provocator: <entryFree id="n39225" type="main" key="pro_vo^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvŏcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39225.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a challenger</hi> to combat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 48 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 10, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:4:12" default="NO">33, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 17, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39225.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a kind of gladiator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:64:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 64, 134</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2566</bibl> and 2568.</sense></entryFree>
provocatorius: <entryFree id="n39226" type="hapax" key="pro_vo^ca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvŏcātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>provocator</etym>, <sense id="n39226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to challenging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provocatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona,</quote> <trans><tr>given to one who had challenged and slain an enemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:11:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 11, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
provocatrix: <entryFree id="n39227" type="main" key="pro_vo^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvŏcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that entices</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">improbitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 18 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,044:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Soph. 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
provoco: <entryFree id="n39228" type="main" key="pro_vo^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-vŏco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n39228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to call forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call out.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39228.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39228.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ubi illaec prodeat, me provoces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandant, ut ad se provocet Simonidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:23:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 23, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum rota Luciferi provocet orta diem,</quote> <trans><tr>lead up</tr>, <tr>call forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:62" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Memnonis mater roseo provocet ore diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:4:58" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 4, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:456" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 456</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">provocare et elicere novas radiculas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:15:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 15, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39228.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39228.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To call out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">challenge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invite</hi> one to any thing (as to play, sing, drink, fight, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">provocat me in aleam,</quote> <trans><tr>challenged me to a game</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to a race</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem tesseris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem cantatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:22:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 22, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 17, 11</bibl> Duker: duces nec <cb n="PROV" /> prohibere paucos temere provocantis volebant, nec, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 16, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et oleo et mero viros provocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad bibendum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Firm. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39228.5" n="2" level="3"> In jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">to take a cause before a higher court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make an appeal;</hi> in this signif. usually <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, ad aliquem; <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> only post-class., with the judge to whom the appeal is made as object (cf. appello). </sense><sense id="n39228.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut de majestate damnati ad populum provocent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: quam id rectum sit, tu judicabis; <cit><quote lang="la">ne ad Catonem quidem provocabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provoco ad populum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arreptus a viatore, Provoco, inquit,</quote> <trans><tr>I appeal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si a duumviris provocarit, provocatione certato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 26, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni judicio poenāque provocari licere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 54</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39228.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appeal to</hi> a judge (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si judicem provocent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:28:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 28, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si praefectus urbi judicem dederit, ipse erit provocandus, qui eum judicem dederit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:3:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 49, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—Also: <cit><quote lang="la">provocare judicium ad populum,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring the decision before the people by appeal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely, aliquem ad judicem,</quote> <trans><tr>to cite</tr>, <tr>summon before</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 360, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39228.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39228.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To challenge to a contest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to contend with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rival</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vie with</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem virtute,</quote> <trans><tr>to vie with him in virtue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elegia Graecos provocamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:93" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 93</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea pictura naturam ipsam provocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 94</bibl></cit>.—Of things, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 8, 12, § 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensum latus Circi templorum pulchritudinem provocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:51:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 51, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39228.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To challenge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provoke</hi> to any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">felicitas temporum, quae bonam conscientiam civium tuorum ad usum indulgentiae tuae provocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 12</bibl></cit> (7) <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni comitate ad hilaritatem et jocum provocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacentes ad communionem sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39228.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exasperate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stir up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rouse</hi> with any thing (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: irrito, lacesso): qui non solum a me provocatus sed etiam suā sponte solet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem beneficio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minis et verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 49</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad iracundiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:63:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 63, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 4, 25</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n39228.12" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To call forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">officia comitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem tot modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19</bibl></cit>, praef. 1, § <cit><quote lang="la">5: bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:16" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39228.13" n="E" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">To appeal</hi> to any thing, <hi rend="ital">to cite</hi> as authority or proof (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad litteras Pudentillae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 84, p. 326, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Judaeorum Codices provocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 202:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 202, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
provolgo: <entryFree id="n39229" type="main" key="provolgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">provolgo</orth>, v. provulgo.</entryFree>
provolo: <entryFree id="n39230" type="main" key="pro_vo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-vŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n39230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fly forth.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39230.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 58, 79, § 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 18, 19, § 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39230.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hurry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hasten forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rush out</hi> (class.): capillo passo in viam provolarunt, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:19:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 19, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito omnibus copiis provolaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in primum infestis hastis provolant duo Fabii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad primores provolat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formicae provolant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 31, 36, § 111</bibl></cit>.— Of things: sonitus provolat ictu, <hi rend="ital">flies forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 294</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
provolvo: <entryFree id="n39231" type="main" key="pro_volvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-volvo</orth>, <itype>volvi, vŏlūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n39231.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39231.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to roll</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tumble forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to roll along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roll over and over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roll away</hi> (class., but not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in viam mediam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi glaeba e terrā provolvitur ingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupas ardentes in opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:42" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congestas lapidum moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galba projectus e sellā ac provolutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 533</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 556</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39231.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., with <hi rend="ital">se</hi> or mid., <hi rend="ital">to cast one's self down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prostrate one's self</hi> at another's feet (syn. prosterno): <cit><quote lang="la">se alicui ad pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flentes ad genua consulis provolvuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provolutae ad pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genibus ejus provolutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:9:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 9, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39231.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to snatch away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurry on</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">multi fortunis provolvebantur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>are ruined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39231.4" n="B" level="2"> Mid., <hi rend="ital">to humble one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad libita Pallantis provoluta,</quote> <trans><tr>submitting to the desires of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provolutus effususque in iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:26:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 26, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
provomo: <entryFree id="n39232" type="main" key="pro_vo^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-vŏmo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n39232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to vomit forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim turbinis atque procellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 447</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1482" /> <cb n="PRUD" /></sense></entryFree>
provorsus: <entryFree id="n39233" type="main" key="pro_vorsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōvorsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from proverto (-vorto).</entryFree>
provulgo: <entryFree id="n39234" type="main" key="provulgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pro-vulgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-volgo</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n39234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make publicly known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to publish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divulge</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationibus provulgatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eas litteras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 84, p. 327, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facti miraculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prox: <entryFree id="n39235" type="gloss" key="prox"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prox</orth> (bona vox, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=253" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 253</bibl> Müll.; cf.: prox, bona vox, ut aestimo, quasi proba vox, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=252" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 252</bibl> Müll.), <pos>interj.</pos>, <sense id="n39235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by your leave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 33</bibl> Fleck.</sense></entryFree>
proxeneta: <entryFree id="n39236" type="greek" key="proxe^ne_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proxĕnēta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">procenhth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a negotiator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">factor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 119" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:14:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 14, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proxeneticum: <entryFree id="n39237" type="greek" key="proxe^ne_ti^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proxĕnētĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">procenhtiko/n</foreign>, <sense id="n39237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brokerage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">factorage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:14:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3" default="NO">3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proximatus: <entryFree id="n39238" type="main" key="proxi^ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proxĭmātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>proximus</etym>, <sense id="n39238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the next place after that of the</hi> magister scriniorum, <hi rend="ital">the proximate</hi>, Cod. Th. 6, 26, 11 and 17.</sense></entryFree>
proxime: <entryFree id="n39239" type="main" key="proxi^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proxĭmē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">proxŭmē</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. propior, II. <sense id="n39239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
proximitas: <entryFree id="n39240" type="main" key="proxi^mi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proxĭmĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>proximus</etym>, <sense id="n39240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nearness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicinity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proximity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39240.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; Ov. de Nuce, 56.—</sense><sense id="n39240.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39240.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Near relationship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 340</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:95" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39240.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Similarity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resemblance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et lateat vitium proximitate boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 662</bibl></cit>; Ap. Asclep. p. 79, 2.—</sense><sense id="n39240.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Connection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">union</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 20, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proximo: <entryFree id="n39241" type="main" key="proxi^mo_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proxĭmō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very lately</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 17, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39242" type="main" key="proxi^mo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proxĭmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n39242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draw near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to approach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be near</hi> (only post - class.; for in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:44:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 44, 112</bibl>, we should read proxima): <cit><quote lang="la">dum in vicum proximamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 169</bibl></cit> Oud.; <cit><quote lang="la">p. 179 Bip.: alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 389</bibl></cit> Oud.: <cit><quote lang="la">ripam maris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, p. 785 Oud.: <cit><quote lang="la">luce proximante,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, p. 332 Oud.: <cit><quote lang="la">per quam proximamus ad Deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 7, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proximus: <entryFree id="n39243" type="main" key="proxi^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proxĭmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">proxŭmus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. propior, II.</entryFree>
proxume: <entryFree id="n39244" type="main" key="proxu^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proxŭmē</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">proxŭmus</orth>, v. proxime, proximus.</entryFree>
prudens: <entryFree id="n39245" type="main" key="pru_dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prūdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contr. from providens</etym>. <sense id="n39245.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Foreseeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreknowing</hi> (very rare); constr. with an <hi rend="ital">objective clause</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille contra urinam spargit, prudens, hanc quoque leoni exitialem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 38, 57, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos prudentis possumus dicere, id est providentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:49:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 49, 111</bibl></cit>: de futuro satis callidus satisque prudens, Ps.-Sall. ap. Cic. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n39245.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39245.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Knowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">experienced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">versed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practised</hi> in a thing (class.; syn.: peritus, consultus); constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug. also with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39245.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterarum rerum pater familias et prudens et attentus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli prudentes, Sall. Ep. Mith. (H. 4, 61, 16 Dietsch): rei militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus rerum prudens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum provinciae prudens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doli prudens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agricolationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentiores rerum rusticarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">earum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulandi gens prudentissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:86" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39245.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudens in jure civili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39245.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec pauperum prudens anus Novemdialis dissipare pulveres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:47" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudens otii vitia negotio discuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1, 4</bibl></cit>:-ob ea se peti prudens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 31, 49, § 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sciens prudensque se praegnantem non esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:6:1:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 6, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39245.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39245.7" n="a" level="4"> Juris prudens, also prudens alone (like juris peritus), <hi rend="ital">skilled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">learned in the law;</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrisprūdens</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi
