rend="ital">one learned in the law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lawyer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jurist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jurisconsult</hi> (only post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:15:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 15, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2" default="NO">1, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:1:7" default="NO">1, 1, 7</bibl>; 40, 7, 30; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39245.8" n="b" level="4"> Like sciens, <hi rend="ital">knowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discreet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prudent;</hi> usually connected with <hi rend="ital">sciens</hi>: prudens animam de corpore mitto, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 150, 8</bibl> (Ann. v. 216 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quos prudens praetereo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 58</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imprudens praeteriisse videris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:77:269" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 77, 269</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">ibis sub furcam prudens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequidquam deus abscidit Prudens Oceano terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 3, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 29, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 364</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">an prudens imprudensve rupisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:34" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 34</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">sciens</hi>:<cb n="PRUI" />  amore ardeo: <cit><quote lang="la">et prudens, sciens, Vivus vidensque pereo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in fabulis Amphiaraus sic ego prudens et sciens ad pestem ante oculos positam sum profectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 9</bibl>, A, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n39245.9" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">sagacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sensible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judicious</hi>, etc. (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">vir naturā peracutus et prudens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis P. Octavio ingenio prudentior, jure peritior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:38:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 38, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentem et, ut ita dicam, catum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:16:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 16, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in existimando admodum prudens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:239" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 68, 239</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentissimi in disserendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 31, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virum ad consilia prudentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo nemo prudentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines amicissimi ac prudentissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:46:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 46, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir bonus et prudens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 445</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si divitiae prudentem reddere possent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentior ille consilio, hic animo magnificentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:8:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 8, 13</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">adverb. acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudens alia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of abstract things: <cit><quote lang="la">prudens, temperata, fortis, justa ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:21:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 21, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudens animi sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 137</bibl></cit>: consilium, quod si non fuerit prudens, Balb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7</bibl>, A, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 433</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentissimum consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 24" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 24</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n39245.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Cautious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumspect</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">malebant me nimium timidum quam satis prudentem existimari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prūdenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">sagaciously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discreetly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wisely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">learnedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prudently</hi>, etc.: loqui, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 255 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem excogitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa ab eo prudenter disputata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa provisa prudenter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Suet. Tib. 21" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Suet. Tib. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 44</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 72, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl> ext. 4.</sense></entryFree>
prudentia: <entryFree id="n39246" type="main" key="pru_denti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prūdentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prudens</etym>. <sense id="n39246.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A foreseeing</hi> (very rare): id enim est sapientis providere: ex quo sapientia est appellata prudentia, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 41, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">futurorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 21, 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39246.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Acquaintance</hi> with a thing, <hi rend="ital">knowledge</hi> of a matter, <hi rend="ital">skill</hi> in a matter: <cit><quote lang="la">juris publici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris civilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:36:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 36, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 13, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">physicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cani rectoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:32" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:48" default="NO">10, 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39246.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., = juris prudentia, Just. Inst. praef. § 2.—</sense><sense id="n39246.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sagacity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prudence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practical judgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discretion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentia constat ex scientiā rerum bonarum et malarum et nec bonarum nec malarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:15:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentia tribus partibus constare videtur, memoriā, intellegentiā, providentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:53:160" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 53, 160</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 2, 3</bibl>: prudentia, quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">fro/nhsin</foreign>, est rerum expetendarum fugiendarumque scientia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:153" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 43, 153</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentia cernitur in delectu bonorum et malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut medicina valetudinis, sic vivendi ars est prudentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilis prudentia,</quote> <trans><tr>statesmanship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:25:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 25, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:53:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 53, 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnes res adhibere prudentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:57:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 57, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:1" default="NO">1, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum fato prudentia major,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velox,</quote> <trans><tr>ready</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ratio et prudentia curas aufert,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prudentius: <entryFree id="n39247" type="main" key="Pru_denti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prūdentĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Aurelius Prudentius Clemens, <sense id="n39247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Christian poet of Calagurris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Spain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who lived in the latter half of the fourth century</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Avit. ad Fascin. Sor. 416</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prugnum: <entryFree id="n39248" type="gloss" key="prugnum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prugnum</orth>, <itype>pro privignum</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=226" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 226</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
pruina: <entryFree id="n39249" type="main" key="pru^i_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŭīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for provina; root pra-, prae; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">prwi+/</foreign>, early</etym>, <sense id="n39249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hoar-frost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rime</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">glacies, gelu),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 60, 61, § 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 431</bibl> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruinae ac nives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matutinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 488</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:287 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 287 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n39249.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39249.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Snow</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">nix concreta pruinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 263</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 368</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:210" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 210</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39249.3" n="B" level="2"> Ad medias sementem extende pruinas, <hi rend="ital">winter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 230</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pruinosus: <entryFree id="n39250" type="main" key="pru^i_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŭīnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pruina</etym>. <sense id="n39250.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Full of hoar-frost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frosty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rimy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:19:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 19, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axis (Aurorae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:6:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 65</bibl></cit>; 1, 13, 2: equi Noctis,<cb n="PRYT" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 2, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:23:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 23, 2</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n39250.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: panni, <hi rend="ital">cold</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">affording no warmth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 83 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
pruna: <entryFree id="n39251" type="main" key="pru_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prūna</orth> <etym>root in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pu=r</foreign>, fire</etym>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n39251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a burning coal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">live coal</hi> (cf. carbo): <cit><quote lang="la">medium per ignem multā premimus vestigia prunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:788" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 788</bibl></cit> Serv.; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 103: latum clavum prunaeque batillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:45 al" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 3, 11, § 45 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
prunitius: <entryFree id="n39252" type="main" key="pru_ni^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prūnĭtĭus</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-cĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prunus</etym>, <sense id="n39252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from plum-tree wood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">torris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 272</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prunulum: <entryFree id="n39253" type="main" key="pru_nu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prūnŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>prunum</etym>, <sense id="n39253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little plum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Or. 1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Or. 1</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
prunum: <entryFree id="n39254" type="main" key="pru_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prūnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>prunus</etym>, <sense id="n39254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cereola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:404" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 404</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:2" default="NO">12, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 13, 13, § 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spini jam pruna ferentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:817" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 817</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:29:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 29, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prunus: <entryFree id="n39255" type="greek" key="pru_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prūnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prou/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n39255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plum-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 10, 19, § 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Feb. 25, 32</bibl>.—Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">prunus silvestris,</quote> <trans><tr>the blackthorn</tr>, <tr>sloe-tree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 7, § 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pruriginosus: <entryFree id="n39256" type="main" key="pru_ri_gi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prūrīgĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prurigo</etym>. <sense id="n39256.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Having the itch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scabby</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pruriginous</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39256.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Lecherous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lascivious</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prurigo: <entryFree id="n39257" type="main" key="pru_ri_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prūrīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prurio</etym>. <sense id="n39257.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An itching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the itch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 80, § 154</bibl> (al. porriginem); 25, 11, 87, § 136; 27, 4, 5, § 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:23:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 23, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39257.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lecherous itching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lasciviousness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:48:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 48, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:73:3" default="NO">11, 73, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 108, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prurio: <entryFree id="n39258" type="main" key="pru_ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prūrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. pruna</etym>, <sense id="n39258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to itch.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39258.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si prurit frictus ocelli angulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:578" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 578</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os prurit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 193" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 193</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39258.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to itch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">long for</hi> a thing. </sense><sense id="n39258.3" n="1" level="3"> For blows, stripes, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitulus prurit in pugnam,</quote> <trans><tr>is eager for the combat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39258.4" n="2" level="3"> For pleasure, <hi rend="ital">to be wanton</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:88:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 88, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:93:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 93, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:37:3" default="NO">6, 37, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:91:8" default="NO">9, 91, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipiant prurire choro puellae,</quote> <trans><tr>to make a wanton display</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:163" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sua desideria coacervabunt sibi magistros, prurientes auribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Tim. 4, 3</bibl></cit> al.; <cit><quote lang="la">in this sense also of things,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:36:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 36, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:96:3" default="NO">12, 96, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pruriosus: <entryFree id="n39259" type="main" key="pru_ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prūrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prurio</etym>. <sense id="n39259.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That causes itching</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bulbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:33" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39259.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Excited by desire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1103,001:63:18" default="NO"><author>Priap.</author> 63, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pruritivus: <entryFree id="n39260" type="main" key="pru_ri_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prūrītīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pruritus</etym>, <sense id="n39260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that causes itching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">itching</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 45, § 157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pruritus: <entryFree id="n39261" type="main" key="pru_ri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prūrītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>prurio</etym>, <sense id="n39261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an itching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the itch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 45, 68, § 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:26" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 16, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:23" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 6, 14, § 23</bibl>; 27, 7, 28, § 51; 30, 3, 8, § 26; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 6, 87</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39261.1" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of sensual desire, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prusa: <entryFree id="n39262" type="main" key="Pru_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n39262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Bithynia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Mount Olympus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Brussa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 43, § 148</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prūsenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Prusa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:66:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 66, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
prusias: <entryFree id="n39263" type="main" key="Pru_si^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prūsĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prūsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*prousi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n39263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Bithynia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who hospitably received Hannibal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but afterwards betrayed him to the Romans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:24:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 24, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:4:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7, 6</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>—Form Prusia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 12, 14</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n39263.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prūsĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Prusias</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Prusiacan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>his kingdom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:888" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 888</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39263.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prūsĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of</hi> (an older) <hi rend="ital">Prusias</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Prusiade</hi>, applied to king Prusias himself, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 345, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prusinius: <entryFree id="n39264" type="main" key="pru_si^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prūsĭnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n39264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of grape</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 7, § 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prymnesius: <entryFree id="n39265" type="greek" key="prymne_si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prymnēsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">prumnh/sios</foreign>, <sense id="n39265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to the stern</hi> of a ship: <cit><quote lang="la">funis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 19, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: palus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=224:16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 224, 16</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
prytanes: <entryFree id="n39266" type="greek" key="pry^ta^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prytănes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">prytănis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pru/tanis</foreign>, <sense id="n39266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the chief magistrates in some of the Grecian States</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 4, 5</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> prytanin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 45, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prytaneum: <entryFree id="n39267" type="greek" key="pry^ta^ne_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prytănēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prutanei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n39267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the town-hall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a public building in some of the Grecian states</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where the Prytanes assembled and dined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and where those who had done special service to the State were entertained at the public expense</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 232</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 20</bibl>.—Also in <pb n="1483" /> <cb n="PSEP" /> RHEGIVM, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3838</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in Cyzicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 23, § 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prytanis: <entryFree id="n39268" type="main" key="pry^ta^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prytănis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. prytanes.</entryFree>
psacae: <entryFree id="n39269" type="main" key="Psacae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Psacae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Scythia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the river Imaus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 19, § 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psallo: <entryFree id="n39270" type="greek" key="psallo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psallo</orth>, <itype>i, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">ya/llw</foreign>. <sense id="n39270.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to play upon a stringed instrument;</hi> esp., <hi rend="ital">to play upon the cithara</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sing to the cithara</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">psallere saltare elegantius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 25, 2</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 23</bibl> the correct read. is saltare et cantare; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Halm ad h. l.): qui canerent voce et qui psallerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cantare et psallere jucunde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 14" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">docta psallere Chia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 33</bibl>. —Of singing to the cithara: Calliope princeps sapienti psallerat ore, Caesius Bassus ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 897</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 5" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 5</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 837.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in caelo cantatur et psallitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39270.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">to sing the Psalms of David</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 107, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 46" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:65" default="NO">65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 14, 15</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
psalma: <entryFree id="n39271" type="greek" key="psalma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psalma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ya/lma</foreign>, <sense id="n39271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a song sung to the accompaniment of stringed instruments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a psalm</hi> (eccl. Lat.). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psalmicen: <entryFree id="n39272" type="main" key="psalmi^cen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psalmĭcen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>psalmus-cano</etym>, <sense id="n39272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a psalm-singer</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psalmidicus: <entryFree id="n39273" type="main" key="psalmi^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psalmĭdĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>psalma-dico</etym>, <sense id="n39273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the psalmist</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Aug. Alterc. Eccl. et Synag. p. 1137.</sense></entryFree>
psalmisonus: <entryFree id="n39274" type="main" key="psalmi^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psalmĭsŏnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>psalma-sono</etym>, <sense id="n39274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a psalm-singer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Homil. Fragm. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psalmista: <entryFree id="n39275" type="greek" key="psalmista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psalmista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yalmisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a composer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">singer of psalms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a psalm-writer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">psalm-singer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">psalmist</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Pelag. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Poen. 2, 8, 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psalmographus: <entryFree id="n39276" type="greek" key="psalmogra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psalmogrăphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yalmogra/fos</foreign>, <sense id="n39276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a psalm - writer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">psalmographer</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. adv. Marc. 3, 130</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> in Conc. post Ep. 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psalmus: <entryFree id="n39277" type="greek" key="psalmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psalmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yalmo/s</foreign>, i. q. psalma, <sense id="n39277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a psalm</hi> (eccl. Lat.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen, hymnus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:38:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 38, 20</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">the Psalms of David</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 20, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 13, 33</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
psalterium: <entryFree id="n39278" type="greek" key="psalte_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psaltērĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yalth/rion</foreign> (e scanned short, Ven. Fort. 2, 19, 43). <sense id="n39278.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A stringed instrument of the lute kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a psaltery</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 215, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 21, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 178</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 32" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:70" default="NO">70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 13, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:56:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 56, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39278.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a song sung to the psaltery.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39278.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A satire</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 101, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39278.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The songs of David</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Psalms</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 53, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">125, 11</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
psaltes: <entryFree id="n39279" type="greek" key="psaltes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psaltes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yalth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a player on the cithara</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a musician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">minstrel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 924</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 331, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 23, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psaltria: <entryFree id="n39280" type="greek" key="psaltri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psaltrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ya/ltria</foreign>, <sense id="n39280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female player on the cithara</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lutist</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 41</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:54:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 54, 116</bibl>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 465, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:336" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 336</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 76" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psamathe: <entryFree id="n39281" type="main" key="Psa^ma^the_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Psămăthē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*yama/qh</foreign>. <sense id="n39281.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Crotopus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Argos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:575" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 575</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39281.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sea-nymph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mother of Phocus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 398</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39281.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fountain in Laconia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Psamathus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 9, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:365" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 365</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psamathus: <entryFree id="n39282" type="main" key="Psama^thu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Psamăthūs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Psamm-</orth>), <itype>untis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*yammaqou=s</foreign>, <sense id="n39282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town and harbor of Laconia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 8, § 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psammetichus: <entryFree id="n39283" type="main" key="Psamme^ti^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Psammĕtĭchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*yamme/tixos</foreign>, <sense id="n39283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who is said to have been the designer of the labyrinth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psaranus: <entryFree id="n39284" type="greek" key="psa_ra_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psārānus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">psārōnĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yarw/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n39284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 43, § 157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psecas: <entryFree id="n39285" type="greek" key="pse^cas1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psĕcas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yeka/s</foreign> (drizzle), <sense id="n39285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female slave who perfumed her mistress's hair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:489" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 489</bibl>: psecade natus, a phrase denoting <hi rend="ital">a man of humble birth</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39286" type="main" key="Pse^ca^s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Psĕcăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n39286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of an attendant of Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 172</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psegma: <entryFree id="n39287" type="spur" key="pse_gma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psēgma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, a false read. for smegma, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 13, 36, § 134</bibl>.</entryFree>

pseudothyrum: <entryFree id="n39327" type="greek" key="pseudo^thy^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pseudŏthyrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yeudo/quron</foreign>. <sense id="n39327.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a backdoor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">private entrance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">postern-gate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palatii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 7, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n39327.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a secret manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(nummi) per pseudothyrum revertantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:20:section=50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 20, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non janua receptis, sed pseudothyro intromissis voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 6, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pseudourbanus: <entryFree id="n39328" type="main" key="pseudo^urba_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pseudŏ-urbānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n39328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imitating the fashion of towns</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
psiathium: <entryFree id="n39329" type="greek" key="psi^athi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psĭathĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yia/qion</foreign>, <sense id="n39329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little rush mat</hi>, Hier. praef. in Reg. S. Pachom. 4.</sense></entryFree>
psila: <entryFree id="n39330" type="greek" key="psi_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psīla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. vestis), = <foreign lang="greek">yilh/</foreign>, <sense id="n39330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering shaggy on one side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shaggy covering</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 540, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psile: <entryFree id="n39331" type="main" key="Psile_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Psilē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n39331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Samos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 38, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psilocitharista: <entryFree id="n39332" type="greek" key="psi_lo^ci^tha^rista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psīlŏcĭthărista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yilokiqaristh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who plays on the cithara without singing to it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a citkara-player</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psilothrum: <entryFree id="n39333" type="greek" key="psi_lo_thrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psīlōthrum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-trum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yi/lwqron</foreign>. <sense id="n39333.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An unguent for removing the hair and making the skin smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a depilatory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 10, 47, § 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 9, 37, § 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:135" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 9, 47, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3</bibl>, praef. 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:93:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 93, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39333.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> ampeloleuce, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 16, § 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psimmythium: <entryFree id="n39334" type="greek" key="psimmy_thi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psimmȳthĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">psimithĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yimmu/qion</foreign>, <sense id="n39334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">white-lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ceruse</hi>, = cerussa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 54, § 175</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psithius: <entryFree id="n39335" type="main" key="psi^thius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psĭthius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. psythius.</entryFree>
psittacinus: <entryFree id="n39336" type="main" key="psitta^ci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psittăcīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>psittacus</etym>, <sense id="n39336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a parrot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collyrium,</quote> <trans><tr>parrot - colored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 27" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psittacus: <entryFree id="n39337" type="greek" key="psitta^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psittăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yi/ttakos</foreign>, <sense id="n39337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a parrot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 42, 58, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:prol. 8" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> prol. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:4:25" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, p. 348</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psoadicus: <entryFree id="n39338" type="greek" key="pso^a^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psŏădĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">yoadiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having pains in the buttocks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">loins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psoleos: <entryFree id="n39339" type="main" key="pso_le^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psōlĕos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the penis</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psophis: <entryFree id="n39340" type="main" key="Pso_phis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Psōphis</orth>, <itype>ī^dis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ywfi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Arcadia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">west of the chain of Erymanthus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tripotamo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 607</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:296" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 296</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Psōphidĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Psophis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 46, 47, § 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psophodees: <entryFree id="n39341" type="main" key="Pso^pho^de^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Psŏphŏdĕes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*yofodeh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">The Bashful Man</hi>, the title of a comedy of Menander, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psora: <entryFree id="n39342" type="greek" key="pso_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psōra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yw/ra</foreign>, <sense id="n39342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the itch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mange</hi> (pure Lat. scabies), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 1, 2, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:41" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 5, 20, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:72" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 22, 32, § 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psoranthemis: <entryFree id="n39343" type="greek" key="pso_ranthe^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psōranthĕmis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ywra/nqemis</foreign>, <sense id="n39343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a barren kind of rosemary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psoricus: <entryFree id="n39344" type="greek" key="pso_ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psōrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">ywriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for the itch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mange</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum,</quote> <trans><tr>good for the itch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 12, 29, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collyrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 32" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 32</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">psō-rĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a remedy for the itch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psyche: <entryFree id="n39345" type="main" key="Psy_che_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Psȳchē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*yuxh/</foreign>, <sense id="n39345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Psyche</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a maiden beloved by Cupid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made immortal by Jupiter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 155</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
psychicus: <entryFree id="n39346" type="greek" key="psy_chi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psȳchĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">yuxiko/s</foreign> (opp. <foreign lang="greek">pneumatiko/s</foreign>), <sense id="n39346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">animal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carnal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carnally inclined</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psychomachia: <entryFree id="n39347" type="greek" key="psy_cho^ma^chi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psȳchŏmăchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yuxomaxi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n39347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">The Contest of the Soul</hi>, the title of a poem by Prudentius.</sense></entryFree>
psychomantium: <entryFree id="n39348" type="greek" key="psy_cho^manti_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psȳchŏmantīum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yuxomantei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n39348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where the spirits of the dead were interrogated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a place of</hi> <pb n="1484" /> <cb n="PTER" /> <hi rend="ital">necromancy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 115</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psychophthoros: <entryFree id="n39349" type="greek" key="psy_cho^phtho^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psȳchŏphthŏros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yuxofqo/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n39349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Soul-destroyer</hi>, an epithet of Apollinarius, who denied the existence of a human soul in Christ, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
psychotrophon: <entryFree id="n39350" type="greek" key="psy_cho^tro^phon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psȳchŏtrŏphon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yuxo/trofon</foreign>, <sense id="n39350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 46, § 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psychrolusia: <entryFree id="n39351" type="greek" key="psy_chro^lu_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psȳchrŏlūsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yuxrolousi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n39351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cold bathing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:14:112" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 14, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psychroluta: <entryFree id="n39352" type="greek" key="psy_chro^lu_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psȳchrŏlūta</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yuxrolou/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n39352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who bathes in cold water</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 53:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 53, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:83:5" default="NO">83, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psylli: <entryFree id="n39353" type="main" key="Psylli"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Psylli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*yu/lloi</foreign>, <sense id="n39353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an African people south-west of the Syrtis Major</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated as serpent-charmers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Psylli nominantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:93" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 25, 38, § 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:893" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 893</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum Psylli secutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
psyllion: <entryFree id="n39354" type="greek" key="psylli^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psyllĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">yu/llion</foreign>, <sense id="n39354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleabane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleawort</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 90, § 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:8:97" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 8, 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psythia: <entryFree id="n39355" type="main" key="psy^thi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psythĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. psythius.</entryFree>
psythius: <entryFree id="n39356" type="greek" key="psy^thi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">psythĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">psĭthĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">yu/qios</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">yiq</foreign>-), <sense id="n39356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">psythian</hi>, a designation of a species of vine: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 269</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 24</bibl>.—Called also simply <orth extent="full" lang="la">psythĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 93</bibl>; and in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">psythiae (sc. uvae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:38" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 38</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">psythĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of raisin - wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
psyttalia: <entryFree id="n39357" type="main" key="Psytta^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Psyttălĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Psittălīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*yuttali/a</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*yutta/leia</foreign>, <sense id="n39357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island in the Saronic Gulf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Salamis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ptarmicus: <entryFree id="n39358" type="main" key="ptarmi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ptarmĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">ptarmiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">causing to sneeze</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:5:71" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 5, 71</bibl>.—Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ptarmĭ-cum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which causes sneezing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:15:138" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 15, 138</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:2:42" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 2, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pte: <entryFree id="n39359" type="main" key="pte^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">-ptĕ</orth>, <itype>a pronominal suffix appended to adjective and</itype> (more rarely) to substantive personal pronouns, esp. in the ablative; the Engl. <sense id="n39359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">own</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meopte ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n39359.1" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">adj. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meāpte malitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuopte ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suopte pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:25:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 25, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suāpte manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrāpte culpā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39359.2" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">subst. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mepte fieri servum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suumpte amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pteleum: <entryFree id="n39360" type="main" key="Pte^le^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ptĕlĕum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ptĕlĕŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pteleo/n</foreign>. <sense id="n39360.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A port in Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over against Eubœa</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Pteleo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:67" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 67</bibl>.—Form Pteleos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 352</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39360.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Messenia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 7, § 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39360.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Ionia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 115</bibl> (al. Ptelea).</sense></entryFree>
ptenethu: <entryFree id="n39361" type="main" key="Pte^ne^thu"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ptĕnĕthu</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n39361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district of Lower Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 49</bibl> (Jan. Ptenethum).</sense></entryFree>
pterelas: <entryFree id="n39362" type="main" key="Pte^re^las"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ptĕrĕlas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ptere/las</foreign>. <sense id="n39362.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A prince of Taphus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:364" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 364</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39362.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of Actœon's hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 212</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pteris: <entryFree id="n39363" type="greek" key="pte^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ptĕris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pteri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of fern</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 9, 55, § 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pternix: <entryFree id="n39364" type="greek" key="pternix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pternix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pte/rnic</foreign>, <sense id="n39364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the straight stem of a plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 57, § 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pteroma: <entryFree id="n39365" type="greek" key="pte^ro_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ptĕrōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pte/rwma</foreign>, <sense id="n39365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the colonnade on the two sides of a Grecian temple</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes">7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pteron: <entryFree id="n39366" type="greek" key="pte^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ptĕron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ptero/n</foreign>, <sense id="n39366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the side walls</hi> of a building, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 13, 19, § 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pterophoros: <entryFree id="n39367" type="main" key="Pte^ro^pho^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ptĕrŏphŏros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pterofo/ros</foreign> (winged), <sense id="n39367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country near the Riphœan Mountains</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 88</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ptĕrŏphŏrītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Pterophoros</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pterotos: <entryFree id="n39368" type="greek" key="pte^ro_tos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ptĕrōtos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pterwto/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">winged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with handles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 66, § 195</bibl></cit> (al. petrotos).</sense></entryFree>
pterygium: <entryFree id="n39369" type="greek" key="pte^ry^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ptĕrygĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pteru/gion</foreign>. <sense id="n39369.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A film that grows over the eye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pearl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">web</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">haw</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 24</bibl>. § 72; 34, 10, 23, § 105.—</sense><sense id="n39369.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A growth of flesh over the nails</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 4, 5, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:26" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 5, 14, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:20" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 4, 5, § 20</bibl>; 30, 12, 37, § 111; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 19, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39369.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cloudy spot in the beryl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 20, § 79</bibl>. <cb n="PUBE" /></sense></entryFree>
pterygoma: <entryFree id="n39370" type="greek" key="pte^ry^go_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ptĕrygōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pteru/gwma</foreign>, <sense id="n39370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">something shaped like a wing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wing of a ballista</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 17</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
ptisana: <entryFree id="n39371" type="greek" key="pti^sa^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ptĭsăna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ptisa/nh</foreign> (al. tisana). <sense id="n39371.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Barley crushed and cleaned from the hulls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barley-groats</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pearl-barley</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:72:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 72, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 93" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:27:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 27, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39371.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a drink made from barley-groats</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barley-water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ptisan</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 550, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 15, § 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ptisanarium: <entryFree id="n39372" type="main" key="pti^sa^na_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ptĭsănārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ptisana</etym>, <sense id="n39372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a decoction of barley-groats</hi>, or, transf., <hi rend="ital">of rice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oryzae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 155</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 13, § 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ptocheum: <entryFree id="n39373" type="greek" key="pto_che_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ptōchēum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īum</orth>,, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ptwxei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n39373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poor-house</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ptochotropheum: <entryFree id="n39374" type="greek" key="pto_cho^tro^phe_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ptōchŏtrŏphēum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ptwxotrofei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n39374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poor-house</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ptochotrophus: <entryFree id="n39375" type="greek" key="pto_cho^tro^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ptōchŏtrŏphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ptwxotro/fos</foreign>, <sense id="n39375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overseer of the poor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ptolemaeus: <entryFree id="n39376" type="main" key="Pto^le^maeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ptŏlĕmaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ptolemai=os</foreign>. <sense id="n39376.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Ptolemy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the name of the kings of Egypt after Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:8:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 8, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:4:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:383" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 383</bibl>.—Hence, in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ptolemaeorum manes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 696</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n39376.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ptŏlĕmaeēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ptolemy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ptolemœan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Egyptian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pharus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39376.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ptŏlĕ-maeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-maeius</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Ptolemœan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ptolemaic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gymnasium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ptŏlĕmaeum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the tomb of the Ptolemies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39376.3" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ptŏ-lĕmāïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Ptolemœan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Egyptian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaza,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 7, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39376.4" n="b" level="4"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n39376.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Cleopatra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Ptolemy Auletes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 69</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39376.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The name of several cities;</hi> in Egypt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 9</bibl>; in Phœnicia, formerly <hi rend="ital">Accho</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">St. Jean d'Acre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 19, 17, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:5:22" default="NO"
