valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 5, 22</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ptŏlĕmāĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 21, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Their inhabitants</hi> are called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ptŏlĕmenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:12:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 12, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:13:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Macc. 13, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39376.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An astrologer of the time of the emperor Otho</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39376.8" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Mauritania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ptyas: <entryFree id="n39377" type="greek" key="pty^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ptyas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ptua/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of serpent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">said to spit venom into the eyes of men</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 6, 18, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:65" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 6, 33, § 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ptychia: <entryFree id="n39378" type="main" key="Pty^chi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ptychĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ptuxi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n39378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island near Corfu</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Vido</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pubeda: <entryFree id="n39379" type="main" key="pu_be_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūbēda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pubes</etym>, <sense id="n39379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a youth arrived at the age of puberty</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, § 908</bibl> (dub.; al. bupaeda).</sense></entryFree>
pubens: <entryFree id="n39380" type="main" key="pu_bens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūbens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">arrived at the age of puberty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pubescent</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n39380.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: frater, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 142: anni, Aus. Idyll. ap. Monos. Membr. 12, 2.— </sense><sense id="n39380.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, <hi rend="ital">in full vigor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">juicy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flourishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exuberant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 514</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes salicum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Idyll. 10, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:129" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 129</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
puber: <entryFree id="n39381" type="main" key="pu_ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūber</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, v. 1. pubes.</entryFree>
pubertas: <entryFree id="n39382" type="main" key="pu_bertas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūbertas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>puber</etym>, <sense id="n39382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the age of manhood</hi> or <hi rend="ital">maturity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puberty.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39382.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">primis pubertatis annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:6:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab initio pubertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:2" default="NO">35, 2, 2</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">circa pubertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 95, § 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubertatis et primae adulescentiae tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">differetur quaestio in tempus pubertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:10:1:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 10, 1, § 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:10:7:section=3" default="NO">37, 10, 7, § 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39382.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39382.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The signs of puberty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the beard</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 33, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 17, § 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:170" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 26, 97, § 170</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39382.4" n="2" level="3"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">soft down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pubescence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23</bibl>, praef. 4, § 7.—</sense><sense id="n39382.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Manhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virility</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inexhausta pubertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 20, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39382.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Youth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young persons</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubertas canis suum honorem reddebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux pubertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 2, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pubes: <entryFree id="n39383" type="main" key="pu_bes1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūbes</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūber</orth> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 707</bibl> P.; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūbis</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, Caes. ib.), <itype>ĕris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root pu-, to beget; in Sanscr. putras, son; pumans, man; cf.: puer, pūpa, putus, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n39383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is grown up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of ripe age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pubescent.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39383.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pubes et puber qui generare potest: is incipit esse a quattuordecim annis: femina a duodecim viri potens, sive patiens, ut quidam putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=250" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 250</bibl></cit> Müll.; Crass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 224</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 129</bibl></cit>: priusquam <cb n="PUBL" /> pubes esset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad puberem aetatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39383.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūbĕres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">grown-up persons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adults</hi>, <hi rend="ital">men</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens, ephebus): omnes puberes armati convenire consuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 26, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:54:6" default="NO" valid="yes">54, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 39</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing. collect.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem Italiae pubem commiserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 23, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 47</bibl>.— Rarely, of one person, <hi rend="ital">a youth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne praejudicium fiat impuberi per puberis personam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:10:3:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 10, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39383.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, <hi rend="ital">covered with soft down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">downy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pubescent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ripe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 413</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 4:4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 4, 4</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39384" type="main" key="pu_bes2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūbes</orth> (<case>nom.</case> pubis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 162</bibl>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. pubes</etym>, <sense id="n39384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the signs of manhood</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the hair which appears on the body at the age of puberty</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">h(/bh</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n39384.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si inguen jam pube contegitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillus et pubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39384.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39384.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The hair</hi> in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ciliorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39384.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The private parts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 427</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:12:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 12, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 83, § 208</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:215" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 15, 60, § 215</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 254, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39384.5" n="C" level="2"> Collect., <hi rend="ital">grown-up males</hi>, <hi rend="ital">youth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young men</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnem Italiae pubem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 23, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 573</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">robora pubis Lecta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:667" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 667</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., of <hi rend="ital">bullocks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 174</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39384.6" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">population</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pube praesenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:268" default="NO" valid="yes">268</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:101" default="NO" valid="yes">68, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dardana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captiva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 46</bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n39384.7" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ripeness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pube agri variorum seminum laeti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pubesco: <entryFree id="n39385" type="main" key="pu_besco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūbesco</orth>, <itype>bŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n39385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to reach the age of puberty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become pubescent.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39385.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. adulesco): molli pubescere veste,</quote> <trans><tr>to put on the down of puberty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 672</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flore novo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:79" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculem, cum primum pubesceret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 32, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos juvenum pubescentium ad militiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer vix pubescente juventā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:678" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nunc aequali tecum pubesceret aevo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubescere bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:429" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dehinc pubescens (Tiberius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubescunt dulces malae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:340" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubescente mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:414" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nati modo pubescentia ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:11" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubescentibus annis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39385.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39385.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be covered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clothed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to clothe itself</hi> with any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): vites laetificae pampinis pubescere, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 69</bibl> (Trag. v. 193 Vahl.); so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgulta fetu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prataque pubescunt variorum flore colorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39385.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To grow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ripen</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia, quae terra gignit, maturata pubescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:28:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 28, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39385.5" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ripen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flourish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be renewed;</hi> of wine, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 7</bibl>.—Of the phœnix renewing its youth, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Phoen. 51</bibl>.—Of the full beams of the rising sun, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 49</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of war: subcrescentis rabiem belli, antequam pubescat validus, opprimere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 13, 14</bibl></cit>.—Of the spring: <cit><quote lang="la">pubescente vere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">30, 5, 1</bibl>.—Of belief: <cit><quote lang="la">pubescente jam fide gestorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pubis: <entryFree id="n39386" type="main" key="pu_bis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūbis</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, v. 1. pubes <sense id="n39386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
publianus: <entryFree id="n39387" type="main" key="Publi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Publĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Publius.</entryFree>
publicanus: <entryFree id="n39388" type="main" key="pu_bli^ca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūblĭcānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>publicus</etym>. <sense id="n39388.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the public revenue</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to the farming of the revenue</hi>: muliercula, <hi rend="ital">the wife of a farmer-general</hi> (with an odious secondary meaning), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:34:section=78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 34, § 78</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n39388.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūblĭcānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n39388.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A farmer-general of the Roman revenues</hi>, usually from the equestrian order (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: manceps, redemptor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 9, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:11:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 11, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:44" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod publicanus ejus publici nomine vi ademerit quodve familia publicanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:7:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 7, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39388.3" n="b" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a tax-gatherer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publican</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 18, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
publicarius: <entryFree id="n39389" type="main" key="pu_bli^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūblĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that makes public</hi> (post-class.), Firm. Math. 3, 8.</sense></entryFree>
publicatio: <entryFree id="n39390" type="main" key="pu_bli^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūblĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>publico</etym>, <sense id="n39390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an adjudging to the public treasury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confiscation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 41, 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
publicater: <entryFree id="n39391" type="main" key="pu_bli^ca_ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūblĭcāter</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a publisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaimer</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">occulti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1485" /> <cb n="PUBL" /></sense></entryFree>
publicatrix: <entryFree id="n39392" type="main" key="pu_bli^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūblĭcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>publicator</etym>, <sense id="n39392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that publishes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exposes</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
publice: <entryFree id="n39393" type="main" key="pu_bli^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūblĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. publicus <sense id="n39393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
publicianus: <entryFree id="n39394" type="main" key="Publi^ci^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Publĭcĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Publicius, B.</entryFree>
publicitus: <entryFree id="n39395" type="main" key="pu_bli^ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūblĭcĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>publicus</etym>. <sense id="n39395.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">On the public account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the public expense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for the State</hi> (ante-class.): publicitus aurum praebere, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 513, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare publicitus cibaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:ib. 10" default="NO"><author>Pompon.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>: proletarius publicitus scutis Ornatur, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 10, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 189 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">hospitio accipi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>into imprisonment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum in aede Dianae publicitus servant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 85</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> XXX. Tyr. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (peccata) prohibere publicitus interest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7</bibl></cit> (6), 14, 4.—</sense><sense id="n39395.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Before the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publicly</hi> (ante- and post-class. for palam): <cit><quote lang="la">ut fiat auctio Publicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 40</bibl></cit>; Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 513, 8</bibl>. In this signif. freq. in App.; so M. 3, p. 136, 25; <cit><quote lang="la">6, p. 176, 3 (opp. privatim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 2, p. 347</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
publicius: <entryFree id="n39396" type="main" key="Pu_bli^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pūblĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens; esp. <hi rend="ital">the brothers</hi> L. <hi rend="ital">and</hi> M. Publicius Malleolus, <hi rend="ital">œdiles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:288" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 288</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n39396.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pūblĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Publician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clivus Publicius,</quote> <trans><tr>a hill in Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 10, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 37</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:294" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 294</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39396.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Publĭcĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Publicius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Publician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus, prob. the Clivus Publicius (v. supra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio, so called after a prætor named Publicius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, tit. 2; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:6:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 6, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
publico: <entryFree id="n39397" type="main" key="pu_bli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūblĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>publicus</etym>. <sense id="n39397.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make public property</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to seize and adjudge to the public use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to confiscate</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">proscribo): regnum Jubae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona Cingetorigis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">privata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:21:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 21, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ptolemaeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censeo publicandas eorum pecunias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:19" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 11, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurarias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39397.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To show</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tell to the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to impart to the public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make public</hi> or <hi rend="ital">common</hi> (freq. only in the post-Aug. period, not in Cic. or Cæs.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vulgo): Aventinum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to open for building</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibliothecas Graecas et Latinas,</quote> <trans><tr>to furnish for the use of the public</tr>, <tr>throw open to the public</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 30, 31, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to let one's self be heard in public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come before the public</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratiunculam,</quote> <trans><tr>to publish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39397.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39397.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reveal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disclose</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">reticenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:17" default="NO">2, 15, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies fasti publicati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39397.4" n="2" level="3"> Corpus publicare, <hi rend="ital">to expose one's self to common use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prostitute one's self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicata pudicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 9, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39397.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lay waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a ruin of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Esdr. 6, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dan. 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
publicola: <entryFree id="n39398" type="main" key="Publi^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Publĭcŏla</orth>, v. Poplicola.</entryFree>
publicus: <entryFree id="n39399" type="main" key="pu_bli^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūblĭcus</orth> (in inscrr. also POBLICVS and POPLICVS), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contr. from populicus, from populus</etym>, <sense id="n39399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">State</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">community; that is done for the sake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at the expense of the State; public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39399.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: multi suam rem bene gessere et publicam patriā procul, <hi rend="ital">the business of the State</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 6, 1</bibl> (Trag. v. 295 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">publica magnificentia (opp. privata luxuria),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 36, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificia publica ac privata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriae,</quote> <trans><tr>done to the State</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae testimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:31:section=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 31, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria publica recensionis tabulis publicis impressa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:30:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 30, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicum funus,</quote> <trans><tr>at the public expense</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defunctum senatus publico funere honoravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <trans><tr>an affair of State</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also,</quote> <trans><tr>a criminal process</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 21, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in causis judiciisque publicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 7</bibl></cit>: res publica, <hi rend="ital">the commonwealth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the State;</hi> v. publicus ludus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in publica commoda peccare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incisa notis marmora publicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 8, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39399.2" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n39399.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūblĭcūs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n39399.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A public officer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">public functionary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magistrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis aut privatus aut publicus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: metuit publicos,<cb n="PUBL" />  <hi rend="ital">the police</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39399.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A public slave</hi> or <hi rend="ital">servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an attendant upon a college of augurs</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 24, 68 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2470</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2853 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n39399.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">publĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n39399.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Possessions of the State</hi>, <hi rend="ital">public territory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">communal property</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicum Campanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:30:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 30, 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39399.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The public purse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the public coffers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">treasury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">public income</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revenue</hi>, etc.: solitus non modo in publico (<hi rend="ital">in public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">openly;</hi> v. under II. b.), sed etiam de publico convivari, <hi rend="ital">at public cost</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:44:section=105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 44, § 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona alicujus vendere et in publicum redigere,</quote> <trans><tr>into the public treasury</tr>, <tr>for public use</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in publicum emere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille et ducenta talenta praedae in publicum retulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicis male redemptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:11:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 11, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conducere publica,</quote> <trans><tr>to farm the public revenues</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere publicum,</quote> <trans><tr>to be a farmer of the public revenues</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frui publico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 1, § 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicum quadragesimae in Asiā egit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicum agitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 119:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 119, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pessimo publico facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to the injury of the State</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39399.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: qui hoc salutationum publicum exercet, <hi rend="ital">who receives pay</hi> (like a porter) <hi rend="ital">for admitting to an audience</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 14:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 14, 4</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n39399.10" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The archives of the State</hi>, <hi rend="ital">public records</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut scriptum in publico in litteris exstat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39399.11" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The commonwealth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">State</hi>, <hi rend="ital">community</hi>, <hi rend="ital">city</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulere in publicum,</quote> <trans><tr>to deliberate for the public weal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39399.12" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">public</hi> (as <pos>adj.</pos> rare, and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">publica lex hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:98" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenum Publica cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favor,</quote> <trans><tr>the favor of all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:14:56" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 14, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux publica mundi,</quote> <trans><tr>the sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <trans><tr>common</tr>, <tr>usual</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:59:1" default="NO">59, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moneta,</quote> <trans><tr>current</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 23, 16</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n39399.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n39399.14" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">publica</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a public woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:37" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39399.15" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pu-blicum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a public place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publicity</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">NEVE IN POPLICOD NEVE IN PREIVATOD, S. C. de Bacchan.: IN. POPLICO, Tab. Bantin. lin. 3: in publico esse non audet, includit se domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:35:section=92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 35, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa in publico copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:35:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 35, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulam in publico proponere,</quote> <trans><tr>publicly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodire in publicum,</quote> <trans><tr>to go out in public</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:31:section=80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 31, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carere publico,</quote> <trans><tr>not to go out in public</tr>, <tr>to remain at home</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abstinere publico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectica per publicum vehi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio, quam nuper in publicum dedi,</quote> <trans><tr>published</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39399.16" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">General</hi>, in a bad sense, i. e. <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordinary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bad</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">structura carminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:13:4" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vatem, cui non sit publica vena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo non publici saporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pu-blĭcē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">poplice</orth>). </sense><sense id="n39399.17" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">On account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the cost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in behalf</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">in charge of the State</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud scio mali quid ortum ex hoc sit publice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">AES. ARGENTVM. AVRVMVE. PVPLICE. SIGNANTO,</quote> <trans><tr>to provide with the public stamp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: VT BONA EIVS POPLICE POSSIDEANTVR FACITO, <hi rend="ital">for the State</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in charge of the State</hi>, Tab. Bantin. lin. 9: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt illustriora, quae publice fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:12:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina puerilis publice exposita,</quote> <trans><tr>on the part of the State</tr>, <tr>by the State</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publice interfici,</quote> <trans><tr>by order of the State</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:224" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 62, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legationis princeps publice dixit,</quote> <trans><tr>in the name of the State</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:44:section=105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 44, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publice maximam putant esse laudem, quam latissime a suis finibus vacare agros,</quote> <trans><tr>in a national point of view</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum, quod Aedui essent publice polliciti,</quote> <trans><tr>for the State</tr>, <tr>in the name of the State</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam atque amicitiam publice privatimque petere,</quote> <trans><tr>on behalf of the public</tr>, <tr>and as individuals</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 55</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea privatim et publice rapere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potius publice quam privatim amicitiam populi Ron ani colere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 49:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 49, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minucius eandem publice curationem agens, quam Maelius privatim agendam susceperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque publice neque privatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:6:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 6, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut filiae ejus publice alerentur,</quote> <trans><tr>at the public expense</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: in urbe, celeberrimo loco elatus publice, id. Dion, 10, 3; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 4, § 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39399.18" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Generally</hi>,<cb n="PUDE" />  <hi rend="ital">all together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">universally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exulatum publice ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Labeo consulentibus de jure publice responsitavit,</quote> <trans><tr>all without exception</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:10:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39399.19" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Before the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">openly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publicly</hi>, = palam (only post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">publice disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem Claudii publice praedicare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> Claud. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumor publice crebuerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 247, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 276, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 2, p. 118, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
publilius: <entryFree id="n39400" type="main" key="Pu_bli^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pūblĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n39400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, of whom the best known are, </sense><sense id="n39400.1" n="I" level="1"> Publilius, <hi rend="ital">brother of Publilia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">second wife of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 32, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39400.2" n="II" level="1"> Volero Publilius, <hi rend="ital">who secured to the plebs the election of the tribunes</hi>, A. U. C. 282, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 55</bibl> sqq. —</sense><sense id="n39400.3" n="III" level="1"> Publilius Syrus, <hi rend="ital">a famous composer and actor of mimes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the beginning of the eighth century</hi> A. U. C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 17, 58, § 199</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 7, 6</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">less correctly called Publius Syrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:14:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11:8 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 11, 8 al.</bibl>; v. Wölfflin, Philol. 22, p. 439 sq.; Teuffel, Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 208, 2. —Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Publĭlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Publilius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 7:18:8 sq" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 7, 18, 8 sq.</bibl></cit> (where the common text has Publiliae).—</sense><sense id="n39400.4" n="IV" level="1"> Publilia, <hi rend="ital">Cicero's second wife</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom he married</hi> B. C. 46, <hi rend="ital">and divorced the next year</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 32, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
publipor: <entryFree id="n39401" type="main" key="Pu_bli^por"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pūblĭpor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Publius-puer, the slave of Publius</etym>. <sense id="n39401.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39401.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A proper name</hi>, Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 700</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
publius: <entryFree id="n39402" type="main" key="Publius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Publius</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman prœnomen;</hi> in writing, abbrev. P.; <cit><quote lang="la">e. g. P. Lentulus, to whom are addressed the letters,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 1</bibl></cit> sqq.; v. also Publilius, III.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Publĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Publius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Publius Syrus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 7:18:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 7, 18, 8</bibl></cit> (where the better reading is Publilianae).</sense></entryFree>
pucinum: <entryFree id="n39403" type="main" key="Pu_ci_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pūcīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pou/kinon</foreign>, <sense id="n39403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Illyria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Proseck</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 18, 22, § 127</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pūcīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pucinum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
